title: Network Architect
description:
Become an integral part of our visionary mission to revolutionize the commercial vehicle industry. Amplify Cell Technologies is a manufacturer of lithium-ion batteries for the commercial vehicle industry. Our commitment to innovation and sustainability drives our mission to provide reliable and efficient energy solutions. As part of our dedication to operational excellence, we prioritize the health, safety, and environmental well-being of our employees and the communities we serve.

Company Overview: Amplify Cell Technologies, created by Accelera, PACCAR, Daimler Truck and EVE is a Battery Cell Manufacturing company dedicated to producing cells mainly for the Commercial Vehicle and Energy Storage Systems market. For more information, please refer to the recent press releases for this announcement on our corporate website at the sites below:

September 6, 2023: https://northamerica.daimlertruck.com/PressDetail/accelera-by-cummins-daimler-truck-and-2023-09-06/

January 18, 2024: https://northamerica.daimlertruck.com/PressDetail/accelera-by-cummins-daimler-truck-and-2024-01-18/

June 4, 2024:

Accelera by Cummins, Daimler Truck and PACCAR complete battery joint venture transaction to form Amplify Cell Technologies and names new CEO | Daimler

Follow us on LinkedIn!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/amplify-cell-technologies/

The Network Architect is responsible for the strategic design and planning of the organization's network infrastructure for a greenfield manufacturing facility. The scope of work includes hybrid cloud datacenter, LAN, WAN, 5G, Wireless, and OT connectivity throughout the manufacturing facility. This role requires a deep understanding of network architecture, security, and performance optimization. In addition to architecting robust and scalable networks, the Network Architect will also serve as a Senior/Lead Network Engineer during operational phases, providing hands-on support, troubleshooting, and leadership to ensure network stability and performance.

What You will Spark at Amplify:
• Network Design and Architecture: Develop and implement strategic network architecture plans to support current and future business needs, focusing on scalability, security, and reliability.
• Infrastructure Planning: Collaborate with IT leadership to align network infrastructure with organizational goals and future growth.
• Operational Support: Act as a Senior/Lead Network Engineer during operational phases, providing advanced support for network issues, troubleshooting, and incident resolution.
• Security Management: Design and implement network security protocols, including firewalls, VPNs, and intrusion detection/prevention systems, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
• Network Optimization: Continuously monitor and analyze network performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing solutions to optimize speed, reliability, and security.
• Project Leadership: Lead network-related projects, from initial design through implementation, coordinating with cross-functional teams and managing resources to ensure successful outcomes.
• Mentorship and Training: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior network engineers, fostering skill development and knowledge sharing within the team.
• Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of network architecture, configurations, and processes to ensure transparency and continuity.
• Vendor Management: Work with vendors and service providers to evaluate new technologies and solutions, ensuring they meet organizational needs and budgetary constraints.
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
• 7+ years of experience in network engineering, with at least 3 years in a network architect or senior engineering role.
• Proven experience in designing and managing large-scale, complex network environments.
• Expertise in network protocols, routing, switching, and network security technologies.
• Proficiency in configuring and managing enterprise-level networking hardware, such as Cisco, HP Aruba, Juniper, Palo Alto, Fortinet, or similar platforms.
• Experience with network monitoring and management tools.
• Familiarity with cloud networking and hybrid environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, etc.).
• Relevant certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, or equivalent are highly preferred.
• Security certifications like CISSP, CISM, or CEH are a plus.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
• Excellent communication and leadership skills.
• Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

This position is domiciled in Byhalia, MS.

#LI-JG1 #LI-On-site

Amplify Cell Technologies is an equal opportunity employer who is committed to providing a diverse work environment where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, age, marital status, family relationship, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression (including transgender and transitioning status), genetic information, veteran status, or any other trait protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. We are an equal opportunity, protected veteran/disability employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to protected status. We participate in the E-Verify program.

title: Cloud Network Architect
description:
About Us
HealthEdge is changing the industry narrative by providing a holistic approach to payment integrity that focuses on comprehensive reimbursement, agile editing, and integrated analytics. Our interoperable, cloud-based solution is modular to meet a health plan's needs today and extensible to grow with their organization over time—bringing disparate parts of a payer's organization together for improved accuracy and insights. The Source platform offers the ability for clients to unlock transformation at the reimbursement, payment integrity, and enterprise level. Our Reimbursement Transformation features Medicare and Medicaid content coupled with flexible contract configuration capabilities for Commercial lines of business. Payment Integrity Transformation includes rich editing libraries with history-based capabilities, easy development of customized edits, and improved transparency to reduce vendor dependency and increase control. As a complete solution, clients can achieve Enterprise Transformation, where root-cause issues are identified and addressed upstream, and all aspects of claims operations are centralized for comprehensive business intelligence. We aspire to have an inclusive workplace where all employees have the opportunity to belong, make an impact, and deliver excellent software and services to our customers.

Your Responsibilities:
• Analyze the capacity needs for the network infrastructure.
• Participate in technology roadmap tracking and provide recommendations as needed.
• Configure, install, upgrade, and maintain appliances that support the network infrastructure environment.
• Manage Palo Alto Firewalls, Cloudflare DNS, Azure Network Security Groups, and Azure User Defined Routes.
• Assist with security assessments and due diligence for all third-party vendors, solutions, and systems to ensure compliance with company policies and procedures, HiTrust, and SOC 2 compliance.
• Design, coordinate, and execute OS network hardening to support network penetration testing.
• Coordinate with Information Security and business groups to assess, implement, monitor, and communicate IT-related security risks and hazards for network, equipment, infrastructure, and non-product-related items.
• Use network/application performance management tools to troubleshoot, analyze, test, and provide recommended solutions for performance problems associated with the company's Azure network infrastructure.
• Solve complex information technology problems in a constantly changing environment.

We Are Looking For:
• Detailed understanding of proxy and firewalls, web application firewalls, and load balancers.
• 3 years of experience working with Cisco and Dell equipment, or equivalent router technology, with a detailed understanding of VLANs, Spanning Tree, and IP routing protocols.
• 3 years of experience managing Palo Alto firewalls.
• 3 years of experience managing Cloudflare.
• Experience with server operating systems and networks.
• Experience working with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), its related networking components, and integrating AKS with Azure networking services.
• Exceptional organizational skills to prioritize work and balance services and project tasks.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Ability to reprioritize tasks on short notice and identify and communicate impacts of changes.
• Experience delivering highly complex technical support to customers, internal systems, and others using effective techniques and methodologies.
• 2 years of experience with application/network/OS and vulnerability remediation.
• Extensive experience with Azure cloud networking.
qualifications: Detailed understanding of proxy and firewalls, web application firewalls, and load balancers, 3 years of experience working with Cisco and Dell equipment, or equivalent router technology, with a detailed understanding of VLANs, Spanning Tree, and IP routing protocols, 3 years of experience managing Palo Alto firewalls, 3 years of experience managing Cloudflare, Experience with server operating systems and networks, Experience working with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), its related networking components, and integrating AKS with Azure networking services, Exceptional organizational skills to prioritize work and balance services and project tasks, Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, Ability to reprioritize tasks on short notice and identify and communicate impacts of changes, Experience delivering highly complex technical support to customers, internal systems, and others using effective techniques and methodologies, 2 years of experience with application/network/OS and vulnerability remediation, Extensive experience with Azure cloud networking

title: Senior Network Architect
description:
Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Network Architect to join our team, providing crucial support to the Network Operations Security Center (NOSC). You will be responsible for the design, development, and deployment of the network enterprise architecture.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Support the enterprise architecture, design, development, and deployment of network services in support of government customer.
• Research and implement enterprise-wide network solutions, capabilities, and enhancements to support customer business/mission goals and objectives, while complying with the network architecture and design standards.
• Produce SDLC project artifacts such as requirements, design documents, diagrams, and other required documentation.
• Troubleshoot network incidents, providing root cause analysis and documenting information in tickets and knowledge repositories.
• Coordinate system maintenance, monitoring, and installation of multiple WAN/LAN environments encompassing multiple specializations, platforms, and technologies.
• Develop and maintain a roadmap for capabilities, operations, and technologies.
• Assist with development and execution of test plans and supporting documentation for network configuration upgrades, additions, or revisions.
• Support network traffic analysis and bandwidth optimization efforts.
• Evaluate and report on new/emerging network/communication technologies to enhance capacity, performance, and reliability.
• Evaluate and recommend changes and/or technology upgrades to address performance, standardization, and industry best practices.
• Follow all customer network security processes and procedures, ensuring compliance with government policies.
• Collaborate and capture customer requirements, presenting customer requirements in technical exchanges with other government agencies.
• Perform site installations, technology refresh, develop implementation plans and schedules.
• Mentor, train, and guide Network Engineers.
• Develop and maintain network architecture diagrams.
• Contribute to documentation in the Knowledge Base, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), work instructions, and job aids.
• Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with operations and engineering teams.
• Perform additional duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications:
• A 8570 Compliant certifications
• A Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification
• A bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, cybersecurity, or a related field of study. Additional years of experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.
• A minimum of (12) twelve years of experience
• Hands-on experience with Cisco routing, switching, and firewall technology
• Experience with primary network topologies, LANs, WANs and other common network standards
• Strong understanding of network protocols and technologies, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and QoS, MPLS
• Very strong knowledge of routing protocols (e.g., BGP, EIGRP, OSPF) and network protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, GRE, IPSEC, and VRF)
• Familiarity with networking technologies including router/switch administration, ethernet and wireless networking and related protocols, hardware installation and support, system security techniques and firewall administration, basic database management.
• Experience with designing, configuring, integrating, and troubleshooting network infrastructure technology
• Experience supporting a switched or routed network environment
• Must have experience creating/writing design documentation, diagrams, and other project artifact deliverables.
• Experience with installation, configuration, problem resolution and maintenance of all network resources, systems and other IT-related technologies.

Preferred Qualifications:
• A master’s degree
• A Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification

Clearance Requirements:
• Must be a U.S. citizen
• Must hold a current Secret clearance
• Must be able to obtain and maintain DHS EOD suitability
• Must be able to obtain and maintain a Top-Secret clearance

Physical Requirements:
• Must be able to remain in a stationary position for extended periods of time.
• Needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.
• Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy, machine, and computer printer.
• The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management, and customers,
• which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.

ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please email us at and provide your name and contact information.

title: Network Architecture Expert
description:
Job Title: Resident Network Engineer
">

Juniper Networks is seeking an experienced Resident Network Engineer to join our team, providing on-site support for our national retailer network in Nashville, TN.
">

About the Role
">

This is a highly technical role, requiring a deep understanding of networking products and technologies. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with our customer's design, implementation, and support personnel to configure and operate Juniper Networks products.
">

Responsibilities
">
">
• To develop and maintain expertise on the products deployed within the Customers' network.">
• To carry out testing of new Designs, features, and functionality as required by the Customer.">
• To troubleshoot equipment and network problems and to open and track JTAC cases through to problem resolution.">
• To raise equipment, Return Material Authorizations (RMA's) and to track these through to problem resolution.">
• To produce a written summary report of the status of Design projects, equipment, and network problems regularly to the Customer.">
• To train the Customer's design, implementation, and support personnel to configure and operate the Juniper Networks products.">
">

Requirements
">

We are looking for a highly skilled individual with at least 5 years of experience providing implementation and technical support of networking products in LAN, WAN, or Internet services environments. You must have a strong understanding of TCP/IP fundamentals, routing protocols (OSPF and BGP), VPNs, and associated tunneling technologies. Your ability to function in a team environment and communicate effectively within the Juniper team is essential.
">

Benefits and Compensation
">

Juniper Networks offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, vacation, sick time, and parental leave. The total compensation package for this position also includes additional details of participation in these benefit plans.
">

E-Verify and Inclusion and Diversity
">

Juniper Networks participates in the E-Verify program and believes in creating a trust-based environment where everyone can thrive together.

title: Cloud Network Architect/Engineer
description:
Overview

GovCIO is currently hiring for Cloud Network Engineer/Architect to support cloud networking and architecting solutions for the customer. This position will be fully remote with a ~10% travel requirement.

Responsibilities

Gathers information concerning the capabilities of Company products; investigates the technical capabilities of Company products and competing equipment and/or solutions; stays abreast of developments in hardware and software. Generates quantifiable requirements based on customer description, system planning and design, and ensures requirements comply through formal verification methods. Translates high level product development strategies into network and system requirement specifications and works with other engineering disciplines to develop lower-level detailed implementation requirements. Establishes and coordinates development of standards, practices, and procedures as related to the network and system development. Designs interfaces and brings network and system elements together, so they work as a whole. Assesses performance using evaluation criteria and technical performance measures. Customer liaison and support for business development activities and to understand and shape requirements.
• Coordinates the planning, design, and installation of equipment, using knowledge of engineering and programming as well as sophisticated instruments and computers
• Participates in system conceptual design and documentation of the design concepts.
• Installs all new hardware, systems, and software for networks.
• Designs, creates, and builds network services, equipment and devices.
• Generates system level requirements verification procedures and customer acceptance test procedures.
• Monitors system performance and implements performance tuning.
• Reviews test plans/procedures and ensures they meet the objectives of the contractual requirements and participates in the testing process to validate requirements.

Develops and/or analyzes and revises existing administrative operations and management controls including standard practices, operating procedures, management systems, and reporting documentation. Develops and/or coordinates improved policies, methods, procedures, instructions, and forms to achieve greater operations efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
• Conduct assessments of current and in-process documents for compliance with regulations, policies, and procedures.
• Identify related policy documents which may be impacted by reviews and updates of other existing content.
• Offer recommendations to retain, revise, or retire existing resource documents based on factors such as utilization, compliance, and other relevant metrics.
• Define technical and/or web content management requirements to improve management of resource documents, including search-ability, currency, and identification of authoritative sources.
• Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs) to modify resource documents and implement recommended framework.
• Responsible for all aspects of network engineering, design, and implementation of AWS cloud solutions.
• Responsible for administration of AWS VPC, Transit Gateways, Wide-area Network, VPNs, Firewalls, and related circuits, services, and devices.
• Implementing and managing AWS network security measures, including Security Groups, Network ACLs, and AWS WAF.
• Integrating hybrid networks with AWS using VPNs, AWS Direct Connect, and other hybrid connectivity solutions.
• Developing and maintaining detailed network diagrams and support procedures in partnership with Network Architects.
• Monitoring network availability and capacity utilization to meet committed availability and quality of service objectives. Provides input into the enterprise capacity planning process.
• Supporting proofs-of-concept design and testing activities and supports the development of change requests, white papers, and proposals with network service components.
• Troubleshooting and resolving network issues across development, testing, and production cloud environments.
• Working with Cloud Engineers and Architects on issues related to cloud infrastructure design and architecture.
• Working with peers within and beyond the Cloud Operations team to define and characterize complex technology or process problems and develop & implement new solutions. As needed, assists with the development of Operations white papers, proposals, and other documentation.

Qualifications

Bachelor's with 12+ years (or commensurate experience)

Clearance Required: Top Secret

Required Skills and Experience
• Must have IAT level II certification (i.e., CompTIA Security+)
• Must have Computing Environment (CE) certification (i.e., AWS, Microsoft, Linux, etc.)
• Demonstrated experience and understanding of DOD Security, RMF, and/or NIST Policies

Preferred Skills and Experience
• Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with customers and internal cross-functional teams
• Experience with virtual and/or cloud-based servers and applications
• Excellent technical documentation and reporting skills
• Effective written and oral communication skills
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Certification(s) in relevant technologies

#NSS

#DL

Company Overview

GovCIO is a team of transformers--people who are passionate about transforming government IT. Every day, we make a positive impact by delivering innovative IT services and solutions that improve how government agencies operate and serve our citizens.

But we can't do it alone. We need great people to help us do great things - for our customers, our culture, and our ability to attract other great people. We are changing the face of government IT and building a workforce that fuels this mission. Are you ready to be a transformer?

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. EOE, including disability/vets.

Posted Pay Range

The posted pay range, if referenced, reflects the range expected for this position at the commencement of employment, however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, education, experience, and internal equity. The total compensation package for this position may also include other compensation elements, to be discussed during the hiring process. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the GovCIO reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, GovCIO or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Posted Salary Range

USD $170,000.00 - USD $190,000.00 /Yr.

title: Network Architect
description:
Network Architect

Date: Jan 8, 2024

Location: The Woodlands, Texas, United States

Company: Entergy

Posting End Date:

Work Place Flexibility: Hybrid

Legal Entity: Entergy Services, LLC

This position can be filled at any Entergy location with Little Rock AR, Jackson MS, The Woodlands TX, or New Orleans LA preferred.

The official title for this position will be Solution Architect, Sr

JOB SUMMARY:

Responsible for leading the IT Network innovation and development of technology solutions, implemented throughout IT, to enable the business to meet its objectives. The role requires an in-depth understanding of available IT networking technologies, the business unit's operations, its operating model, capability needs, and business challenges. The role, together with support from Entergy's network engineering function, are responsible for creating a fully integrated, effective business solution. The role is an active thought leader and application visionary who shapes the technology demand among the business unit.

JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Provide overall design guidelines for network integration, performance, reliability, operating, and innovation. Support business units in the creation of project business cases (e.g., success criteria).
• Capture business capability requirements, functional requirements, and expected service levels from business unit to create an actionable IT-Networking roadmap (a long-range plan for the business that identifies specific IT investments in infrastructure to support business objectives).
• Support infrastructure leadership in identifying opportunities for emerging technologies, through collaboration, to enable business strategies. Provide an advisory role with the client on the impact of new technologies on their existing technical and network environment.
• Work with BA and PM teams to review strategies and requirements. Ensure business and functional requirements are maintained throughout the development/configuration process. Review and analyze results to validate the functions of the delivered solution.
• Maintain strong understanding of networking technology needs and solutions for the business unit. Regularly visit business units to assess satisfaction and identify follow-up opportunities. Consider alternate delivery models for meeting business needs.
• Liaise between the client, vendors, project management and the technical teams on questions, issues, and revisions to the solution architecture.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION:

Minimum Education required for this position

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience. Masters degree is a plus.

Minimum Experience required for this position

At least 10 years of experience working with networking technologies and how it supports the business

Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required for this position:

Demonstrated expertise in Cisco networking, TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, WINS, network management tools, use of packet capture and other troubleshooting tools.

Deep understanding of CISCO routers and switches as well as firewalls and intrusion detection/prevention devices.

Demonstrates strong knowledge of RIPv1/v2, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, NAT, Access-Lists, route re-distribution, IP Multicast, VLANs, SD-WAN, VPC, EVPN/VXLAN and spanning tree.

Previous networking experience maintaining NERC CIP environments, use of Cisco Prime/DNAC/DCNM, demonstrated experience with Software Defined Networking / Application Centric Infrastructure, Aruba wireless environments, VMWare, a plus.

Strong familiarity with cloud networking (AWS: VPC, Transit Gateways, Direct Connect, ELB/ALB, Route 53)

Experience with cloud (AWS, Azure, GC) network and/or security desirable

Any certificates, licenses, required of this position:

CCIE, JNCIE certifications preferred

title: Senior Network Architect Position
description:
Next Step Innovation Overview

As a pioneering force in the industry, Next Step Innovation is dedicated to harnessing the power of technology to drive innovation and growth. Our team of experts is passionate about delivering tailored solutions that address the unique needs of each client.
Job Description

This role involves working as part of a collaborative team to design, implement, and maintain advanced network infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in systems engineering, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment.
Responsibilities
• Support the sales team by attending customer meetings, POCs, and presentations to demonstrate our capabilities.
• Develop and deliver network solutions that align with customer objectives and preferences.
• Engage with Project Management to ensure timely and successful project execution.
• Deploy network infrastructure, leveraging expertise in LAN configuration, routing, wireless, and firewall design.
Required Skills and Qualifications

title: IT Project Manager
description:
The CIty of Bryan is accepting applications for IT Project Manager. This position plans, coordinates, and manages one or more large scale IT projects of varied complexity through the project’s lifecycle and implementation. Responsibilities include assisting with the evaluation and selection of appropriate technology solutions, acting as the liaison between the customer department and the hardware/software vendor, and managing the coordination and scheduling of IT and department resources to implement the selected solution.

Hiring Pay Rate
$73,000-$100,000 (depending on qualifications)

Responsibilities
• Leads and manages moderate to complex, large-scale City-wide and/or departmental IT projects and programs from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to project scope, schedule, and budget.
• Develops and maintains comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.
• Facilitates project meetings, including kick-off meetings, status update meetings, and post project debriefing meetings.-
• Prepares and presents project reports, presentations, and other communications to stakeholders and IT leadership.
• Collaborates with stakeholders across different city departments to understand project requirements and objectives. This may include overseeing the development of functional and technical requirements.
• Develops a comprehensive understanding of customer/department processes and workflows, to better manage the selection and implementation of technology solutions based on customer needs.
• Manages the procurement process by partnering with Finance/Purchasing and the project team, to secure vendor provided professional/consulting services, hardware, and software solutions.
• Monitors project progress and provides regular updates to stakeholders and IT management.
• Identifies and mitigates project risks and issues and implements effective risk management strategies.
• Ensures project deliverables meet quality standards and comply with relevant regulations and best practices.
• Implements and adapts project management methodologies and follows the established project framework policies.
• Contributes to the continuous process improvement of the overall organizational project management maturity.
• Remains current on industry standards and principles through regular review and study of technical material via online classes and training site subscriptions.
• Provides after hours migration support and other job-related support as needed.
• Performs related duties as required.

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Project Management, Computer Science, Business, Public Administration, Information Systems, Accounting, or a similar field of study plus at least 4 years of analytical/systems related experience or experience pertaining to managing multiple large scale projects simultaneously OR a Master’s Degree plus at least 2 years of experience as listed above; oran equivalent combination of related education, experience, certification, and training may also be considered.
• Familiarity with project management methodologies, including Agile, Scrum, and Waterfall.
• Proficiency in project management tools and software, such as Smartsheet, Microsoft Project, etc.
• Familiarity with project management methodologies, including Agile, Scrum, and Waterfall.
• Proficiency in project management tools and software, such as Smartsheet, Microsoft Project, etc.

title: Senior IT Project Manager
description:
** If you are interested in applying for this position, please email your resume to Maddie Watt at mwatt@apexsystems.com **

Job title: Sr. IT Project Manager
Industry: Commercial Banking
Contract term: 1 year – contract to hire
Location: San Antonio, TX – hybrid (2-3 days on site)
Rate: up to $60/hr.

Job Summary:
As a Senior IT Project Manager, you will be responsible for coordinating the implementation of business systems in support of our banking technology programs. We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior IT Project Manager specializing in IBM mainframe technologies to lead our critical projects. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in managing complex mainframe initiatives, a deep understanding of project management methodologies, and the ability to drive teams towards achieving strategic goals. This role requires exceptional leadership skills, technical acumen, and a collaborative approach to ensure project success.

Key Responsibilities:

\tLead and oversee multiple IBM mainframe projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
\tDevelop comprehensive project plans, including scope, budget, timeline, resource allocation, and risk management strategies.
\tCollaborate with stakeholders across departments, ensuring clear communication and alignment on project deliverables and timelines.
\tMonitor project performance, identifying and addressing issues proactively to keep projects on track.
\tFacilitate cross-functional team meetings, providing direction and motivation to team members.
\tEstablish and maintain strong relationships with clients and vendors to ensure project success and satisfaction.
\tImplement best practices in project management, continuously improving processes and methodologies.
\tConduct post-project reviews to assess outcomes, identify lessons learned, and recommend improvements for future projects.
\tMentor junior project managers and team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and professional growth.

Qualifications:

\tBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
\t7+ years of project management experience, with a minimum of 5 years focused on IBM mainframe projects.
\tStrong knowledge of mainframe technologies, including z/OS, DB2, CICS, Data Warehouse and relevant development tools.
\tProven experience with project management methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid approaches.
\tPMP or equivalent certification is highly desirable.
\tExcellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with a track record of successful stakeholder management.
\tStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex project environments.
\tProficient in project management software and tools.

We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.

title: IT Project Manager (Cloud & Datacenter)
description:
Role Outline
• We are seeking a highly motivated and organized IT Project Manager to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for successfully planning, executing, and delivering a variety of IT projects for our Managed Service Provider (MSP) and Enterprise clients.
• The key projects of focus will be around on-premis datacentre but primarily supporting clients with their adoption and expansion of cloud hosting services.
• You will work closely with internal infrastructure teams as well as external development teams, solution architects, and stakeholders to drive the successful implementation of services that meet business objectives.
• Throughout delivery you will be focused on successful delivery along side ensuring full transparency of project financials, risks and issues.
• You will be expected to work with internal and 3rd party resources and be customer facing as you will play a critical role in ensuring client satisfaction and on-time project delivery.

Key Responsibilities
• Project Planning and Execution

o Lead end-to-end project management for cloud and infrastructure initiatives, including defining project scope, goals, deliverables, and timelines.

o Deliver projects in alignment with company procedures and PMO standards.

o Leverage project level experience to improve the overall tech transformation program.

o Work within PMO tooling (Wrike) to develop comprehensive project delivery plans.

o Coordinate internal resources and third-party vendors for the flawless execution of AWS projects.
• Stakeholder Management

o Provide regular technical, status, and budget updates to senior management.

o Liaise with key stakeholders, including project personnel, vendors, and end-users, to ensure project requirements are met throughout the project lifecycle.

o Able to accurately forecast, track and report on project KPI’s.
• Risk Management

o Strong Risk and Issue (RAID) management capabilities.

o Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to address them proactively.

o Ensure compliance with leading best practices, industry standards, and relevant security and regulatory requirements.
• Budget and Resource Management

o Monitor project progress, manage budgets, and raise change orders as necessary.

o Manage project budgets, resources, and costs, ensuring efficient utilization.

o Track and report on project financials, ensuring projects are delivered within budget.
• Quality Assurance and Monitoring

o Ensure compliance with best practices, SOPs, PMO policies, and customer-mandated policies.

o Implement quality control processes to ensure deliverables meet the highest standards.

Qualifications/Experience
• Experience

o At least six (6) years of experience in project management with 2+ years managing cloud projects

o Technical understanding of networking, infrastructure & cloud components to ensure technical delivery turn-up sequencing leading to success.

o Proven experience with AWS cloud services such as EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC, IAM, CloudFormation, etc.

o Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, including developers, DevOps engineers, and architects. Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders across all levels, ensuring transparency and alignment.

o Beneficial to have experience around delivery of projects relating to Cloud Cost Management function and reporting.

o Experience within Managed Service Provider (MSP) preferred.
• Technical Knowledge

o Strong understanding of cloud architecture (AWS specifically), cloud infrastructure, and cloud-native application development.

o Familiarity with cloud security best practices and compliance frameworks (e.g., AWS Well-Architected Framework).

o Foundational understanding of on-premis technologies and architectural principals to ensure the most efficient delivery is possible
• Project Management Skills

o Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., Wrike, JIRA, MS Project, Trello).

o PMP, PRINCE2, or equivalent certification preferred.

o Experience with Waterfall & Agile/Scrum methodologies.
• Communication and Leadership

o Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.

o Ability to present complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders clearly.

o Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
• Problem Solving and Analytical Skills

o Ability to navigate technical and operational challenges, providing creative solutions.

o Strong analytical skills to assess project risks, impact, and alternatives.

Company Culture

We are a 'can do – will do' company that prides itself on delivering on our promises without compromise on quality.

Working Time
• This position operates primarily within the US Central Time Zones, with flexibility to accommodate customer needs. While the standard working days are Monday to Friday, occasional weekend work may be required based on project demands.
• Candidates within the Austin, Texas area preferred if able to travel to the office 1-2 times a week.

Note

This job description is not exhaustive and may be amended by the Company at any time.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid time off
• Referral program
• Relocation assistance
• Vision insurance

Compensation Package:
• Yearly pay

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday
• Weekends as needed

Experience:
• AWS: 2 years (Required)
• Project management: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:
• San Marcos, TX 78666 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: IT Project Manager
description:
Centre Technologies is a full-service Managed Services Provider (MSP), with Cloud Delivery, and Cyber Security solutions that provide IT solutions for our customers in Houston, Austin, San Antonio, Dallas, and surrounding areas. We employ IT experts who are able to identify, assess, design, deploy, and support any IT solutions from the classic to the cutting-edge.

We are excited to announce we are expanding and looking to grow our IT Consultingteam with a new IT Project Manager!

Position Summary

The Project Manager will manage, coordinate, and establish priorities for the complete life cycle of Centre projects including the planning, testing, and implementation of solutions designed to meet the project requirements. Determining the project needs and acquiring resources required for the success of the project is necessary to ensure successful project delivery within the scope of work and proposed budget. This individual will make recommendations on strategies, identifying areas of opportunity, provide direction and guidance while anticipating project requirements for successful project completion.

Please complete the Project Manager online assessment:Project Manager Online Assessment

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
• Plans, controls, and executes project requirements following Centre processes
• Works with Resource Managers to staff projects.
• Defines and communicates roles for project team members (functional-technical).
• Works with customers and technical resources to develop project plans, detailing work breakdown structures.
• Ensures that requirements are contained within the defined scope.
• Manages customer and external supplier deliverables.
• Develops communication strategies and leads communications with key stakeholders.
• Document and drive issues through resolution, escalating to the customer and IT management as necessary.
• Makes recommendations to improve project management processes

Education/Experience/Certifications
• Bachelor’s Degree preferred
• Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification preferred
• 3+ years experience managing IT projects

Work Environment and Physical Demands
• Work primarily in a climate-controlled environment with minimal safety/health hazard potential.
• Occasional lifting (up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds) may be required
• Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities/injuries to perform the essential functions of this role
• The noise level in the work environment is moderate
• Some travel required

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
▶ Who we are

With more than 13,000 stores in the U.S. and 84,500 stores globally, it is no wonder 7-Eleven, Inc. has been named an iconic brand. In addition to 7-Eleven stores, 7-Eleven, Inc. also operates and franchises Speedway, Stripes, Laredo Taco Company and Raise the Roost locations.

Since inventing the convenience industry in 1927, 7-Eleven has built a rich 96-year history filled with beloved products like Slurpee, Big Gulp and Big Bite, and fan-favorite holidays like Slurpee Day and Bring Your Own Cup Day.

Now, 7-Eleven is on a mission to contemporize the brand and redefine convenience – and we need your help.

▶ About This Opportunity

JOB SUMMARY:

We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Project Manager to join our Fuels back office team. The Technical Project Manager will be responsible for leading and managing complex technical projects from initiation to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent project management skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve project objectives.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:

· Ensures that program scope and business objectives are clearly documented and agreed to for complex, cross-functional projects.

· Work with technical teams and technical team leadership to align on timelines and ensure tech teams deliverables are met.

· Identify and organize appropriate cross-functional teams to achieve project goals. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop detailed project plans. Identifying the proper work streams owners and cross-work stream dependencies. Coach teams to ensure the project team works together efficiently and effectively.

· Work collaboratively with business owners to define the initial budget and resources required. Manage and analyze on-going financials to ensure the project is tracking to budget.

· Understand the details of the project plan to effectively manage the dependencies and adjust plans as necessary. Drive accountability and project progress according to the aligned project plan.

· Identify and document project risks and issues, escalating when appropriate and developing mitigation strategies to minimize project impacts.

· Through regular cadence of reporting, ensure visibility and transparency on project progress milestones, financial governance, issues, and risks.

· Focus on driving results, finding cost savings opportunities and efficiencies in the project life cycle while leveraging project management best practices.

· Ability to effectively facilitate meetings of varying size and purpose.

· In addition to the skills above, the Project Manager needs to be proficient and demonstrate the following leadership competencies:

. Ability to effectively build relationships to influence stakeholders and teams through indirect leadership, working across organizational lines and varying levels of the organization, including VP/SVP level.

. Demonstrated ability to communicate key project points and adjust communications as needed based on audience, making the complex simple to understand.

. Develop an understanding of company vision, strategy, and key initiatives. Achieve detailed understanding of the functional area of the project and related processes to be able to challenge assumptions and thinking and provide thought leadership.

. Ability to solve problems by assessing the situation, leveraging data where applicable, identifying root cause and developing potential solutions.

. Ability to operate in environments with ambiguity and ability to create clarity.

. High level of agility and adaptability; ability to quickly learn details of new business functions and operate in various project methodologies.

. Identify dependencies and impacts of project changes across other key initiatives.

. Contribute to continuous improvement of Store Technology team processes and maturity.

. Manage collaboration and communication with other teams, both internal and external, to ensure teams have what they need and can work efficiently.

. Technical background, Project Management and Release and Delivery management is key for this role.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

EDUCATION: Bachelors/4 Yr Degree

YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE: 8+ years

SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

· Strong technical background with experience in software development, IT infrastructure, or related fields, and a good understanding of technical concepts and terminology.

· Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies, with experience using tools such as Jira, Rally or ADO and knowledge of Agile, Scrum, or other iterative development methodologies.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and build strong relationships with team members and clients.

· Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire cross-functional teams to achieve project goals and objectives.

· Analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and make decisions under pressure.

If an hourly or salary range is included in this ad it represents the range 7-Eleven in good faith believes is the range of compensation for this role at the time of this posting. The Company may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in this state. This range may be modified in the future. title: Information Technology Project Manager
description:
Seeking a Senior Technical Project Manager with experience managing SDLC projects from inception to delivery.

This role is slated to be a long-term contract with extensions.

Seeking an experienced Technical Project Manager with a background supporting data projects and proven experience partnering with Product. The Project Manager will play a pivotal role in leading and executing complex technical projects, ensuring their successful delivery within scope, schedule, and budget. This role requires a deep understanding of Agile principles, exceptional project management skills, leadership capabilities, and effective communication to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Day to day involvement in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, systems, and platforms that enable data-driven decision making and analytics. As a data engineering project manager, you need to have a combination of technical, business, and soft skills to ensure the success of your project.

Responsibilities:
• Agile Leadership: Champion Agile principles and practices throughout the project lifecycle. Lead Agile ceremonies, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives. Guide the team in adopting and adhering to Agile methodologies.
• Scope and Iteration Management: Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders, breaking them down into manageable iterations. Develop and maintain a well-defined product backlog and ensure Timely delivery of prioritized features
• Resource Allocation: Identify and allocate necessary resources, both internal and external, required for project success. Foster a collaborative and self-organizing team environment that encourages ownership and accountability
• Risk and Issue Management: Proactively identify potential risks and issues within the Agile framework. Work closely with the team to address challenges and impediments promptly, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
• Communication and Stakeholder Engagement: Facilitate open and transparent communication with stakeholders, providing regular project updates, progress reports, and demos. Ensure alignment between project goals, user stories, and business objectives.
• Technical Proficiency: Possess a strong understanding of the technical aspects of the projects being managed within an Agile context and possess an understanding of data flows in an enterprise.
• Quality Assurance: Drive a culture of quality and continuous testing within Agile iterations. Collaborate with the team to ensure the delivery of high-quality, functional increments in each iteration.
• Change Management and Adaptability: Embrace change and uncertainty inherent in Agile projects. Guide the team and stakeholders through iterations, ensuring a smooth transition to new features and updates.
• Agile Coaching and Mentorship: Mentor and guide junior project managers and team members on Agile practices, fostering skill development and Agile maturity.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. (Equivalent experience acceptable).
• PMP, PMI-ACP, Certified ScrumMaster, or other relevant Agile certifications are a plus.
• 5+ years of proven experience as a Technical Project Manager successfully delivering complex technical projects in iterative and incremental cycles.
• Data Focused aptitude and experience
• Develop and maintain relationships with data migration project stakeholders
• Day to day involvement in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, systems, and platforms that enable data-driven decision making and analytics. As a data engineering project manager, you need to have a combination of technical, business, and soft skills to ensure the success of your project.
• Understanding of Agile principles, values, and frameworks (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
• Proficiency in Agile project management tools and software.
• Exceptional leadership, team management, and servant leadership skills.
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal abilities.
• Track record of effectively managing Agile project budgets, resources, risks, and timelines.
• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and adapt to changing priorities

title: IT Project Manager
description:
IT Project Manager
Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced
Department: Information Technology
CGS is looking for an IT Project Manager to assist with the design, development, and oversight of various ongoing efforts in the IT department of a large federal entity. The PM will participate in project design, assist with the development of project plans, assess available resources, and implement the management plans for new and ongoing projects. The candidate for this position should have a strong understanding of Agile project management principles for both large and small projects as well as be experienced and comfortable with acting as team lead or primary liaison for project information.
CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve government's most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.
Skills and attributes for success:
• Define project scope and schedule while focusing on regular and timely delivery of value.
• Organize and lead project status and working meetings.
• Prepare and distribute progress reports.
• Manage risks and issues; correct deviations from plans and perform delivery planning for assigned projects.
• Define and develop initiatives for continuous business process improvements and monitoring.
• Manage the team in making business decisions relating to system implementation, modification and maintenance.
• Develop and update business process documentation for testing and training management.
• Define and manage a well-defined project management process and champion ongoing process improvement initiatives to implement best practices for agile project management.
• Deliver an agile transformation plan to move from current state to a desired state.
• Use standard project performance metrics to assess and evaluate the program.
• Aid in the implementation and facilitation of the use of agile tools, guidelines and metrics in order to achieve a standardized approach to agile team project execution.
• Monitor the overall cost, control, adherence to schedules, and technical quality of work.
• Prepare and provide technical analysis reports as directed by the Agency to support discussions.
Qualifications:
• Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Information systems or a related discipline.
• 5 years of experience in project management.
• At least 5 years of experience in managing IT related projects and must demonstrate a leadership role in at least 3 successful projects that were delivered on time and on budget.
• At least 5 years of experience in information system design and development experience in one or more general purpose programming language development such as JavaScript and Java.
• Knowledge in system integration using Application Program Interface (API) management technologies, and a working knowledge of the RESTful APIs platform, API design, and development on the cloud as well as on-premise environments.
• Experience in RDBMS and NoSQL database development experience with strong fundamentals in algorithm design, problem-solving, and complexity analysis.
• At least 5 years of experience in managing an Agile scrum team with developers, testers and DevOps team using Agile processes and practices.
• Experience working with public agency interfaces.
• A Master's Degree or project management certification.
• At least 5 years of programming experience in Java, JavaScript, JBOSS Fuse, Angular JS.
• Experience in health and human services domains such as eligibility, enrollment, Medicaid, child welfare, and child support systems.
• Experience building complex software systems with one or more general-purpose programming languages.
• Knowledge of best practices for the full Agile SDLC, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
• Integration experience with financial management systems.
• Experience working with two or more from the following: web application development, mobile application development, information retrieval, developing large software systems, and/or security software development.
• Industry certifications/licenses.
Ideally, you will also have:
• Client-facing communication experience.
• Federal Agency issued security clearance.
Our commitment:
Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our clients' specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.
For the past seven years we've been growing our government-contracting portfolio, and along the way we've created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.
Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.
We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package.
• Health, Dental, and Vision
• Life Insurance
• 401k
• Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter)
• Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays
Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Join our team and become part of meaningful government innovation!
Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:
https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/
For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:
Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Sr IT Project Manager
description:
Description
Snap One is a leading manufacturer and exclusive source of control, A/V, surveillance, networking, power, and infrastructure equipment for residential and commercial professionals. With a vast catalogue of today’s most popular brands, Snap One is the premier choice for professional installers across the globe. We believe that life’s better when everything works together, and the same can be said about the collaborative work we do. Join our award-winning team in our continuous quest to deliver the most brilliant, personalized smart living and smart business experiences to people around the world.

Reporting to the Director of IT the Senior IT Project Manager is a project leader, business partner, and mentor responsible for scope, time, finance, quality, and overall performance management. An ideal candidate possesses strong project management, consulting, technical, business, and personal leadership skills to lead multiple large-scale projects and programs across a dynamic enterprise. The candidate should have strong analytical and facilitation skills and the ability to interpret and anticipate customer needs to develop clear and attainable goals, objectives, and execution plans.

Specific Responsibilities
• Lead others through business change and implementation plans. Drives teams to consensus and completion
• Interpret business needs and define realistic goals and objectives
• Scope projects to align with goals and objectives and deliver incremental value
• Hold individuals accountable for project deliverables
• Tailor the project lifecycle to meet project needs
• Manage scope, schedule, budget, quality, risk, and overall performance
• Adhere to all Snap One project management and IT standards
• Evaluate and manage third-party contracts and resources required for project delivery
• Effectively communicate and collaborate with all levels of stakeholders
• Build, lead, and motivate project teams. Facilitate project team meetings and workshops to solve problems and achieve successful outcomes. Keep the project team on task to meet project deadlines
• Anticipate project challenges and risk scenarios and prepare, lead, and execute proactive risk response strategies to ensure optimal results
• Focus on quality and value in all project activities
• Mentor project managers in project management best practices and adherence to Snap One standards
• Contribute to project management standards

Required Qualifications
• 5+ years of relevant industry experience leading large and complex programs and projects
• Applied Project Management skills with classical (Waterfall, ITIL) & agile (Scrum, Kanban) methodologies
• Proven track record of achieving business objectives through leading complex enterprise-wide programs. 
• Collaborative; Excellent interpersonal effectiveness; Able to have critical conversations.
• Able to achieve buy-in at executive & all levels and influence without authority. Readily understands business drivers, program impact, and individual motivations.
• Deep understanding of Program and Project Management best practices and strong organizational skills

Preferred Qualifications
• Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
• Experience with JIRA and Confluence
• Experience with Hybrid Software Development (Agile and Waterfall)
• Relevant experience working in the IT and retail industry

Snap One is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Senior IT Project Manager - Hybrid
description:
MODE Global is the 5th largest truckload broker and largest non-asset intermodal provider in North America. With over 200 agents/offices distributed from coast to coast, MODE Global operates under a family of businesses and brands, delivering as a premier full-service solutions provider to the logistics industry.

JOB SUMMARY: The Senior IT Project Manager is responsible for leading and managing projects that leverage a mix of off-the-shelf applications and proprietary software solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in technical project management, exceptional leadership skills, and the ability to drive projects to successful completion in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. The position will utilize a mixture of Waterfall and Agile project management processes and methodologies to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget and scope, while adhering to high quality standards and customer expectations. The Senior Project Manager must possess advanced knowledge and expertise in the use of project management methodologies, tools, techniques, resource management practices, budget management and tracking, and change management techniques at both the sub-portfolio and project level. This position may require the management, mentoring and coaching of other project managers. The Senior Project Manager will be responsible for continuous management and strategic planning for the sub-portfolio they are assigned.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, business and technical product managers, vendors, and business stakeholders to plan, execute, and manage technical projects from inception to completion, ensuring alignment with business goals, scope, budget, and timelines.
Understand the integration and customization of off-the-shelf applications and proprietary software.
Work closely with technical teams to identify potential challenges and recommend solutions to ensure seamless software deployment and operation.
Serve as the primary point of contact for project updates, delivering clear and concise communication to stakeholders at all levels.
Create project plan, resources plan and budget for the assigned project.
Schedule and facilitate regular status meetings, progress reports, and post-project evaluations.
Work with business leaders to identify business needs and develop those needs into project requests.
Adhere to project intake and approval processes prior to resource allocation, scheduling commitments and project kick-off.
Identify and manage business requirements, deliverables, resource needs, change requests, project plans, project risks, and project closure and transition.
Direct and monitor project work efforts daily.
Track project progress and distribute regular status reports to applicable stakeholders.
Manage and escalate functional, quality, timeline, and all other project issues.
Collaborate with IT leadership to develop and enforce best practices for project management, including risk management, quality assurance, and change control processes.
Manage dependencies, resolve conflicts, and ensure projects remain on track.
Collaborate with external vendors and third-party providers to manage relationships, negotiate contracts, and oversee deliverables related to off-the-shelf applications.
Assist IT Department with annual Strategic Planning and Budget activities, documentation and meetings.
Manage, train, and coach project managers to help strengthen skills and deepen understanding of the business and relevant industry.
Continually assess and improve project management methodology and practices.
Ensure all internal controls and policies are adhered to for projects and systems change management.
Limited travel
Other duties as assigned by management

Education/Training:
Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience and education through certifications, PDUs or other training.

Skills and Experience:
Minimum 5-10 years with managing multi-faceted projects
Minimum 3-5 years directly managing other project man
Working with external customers and outside vendors
Leading internal and external resources, including Business Area Management and IT Resources
Proficient in leading Technology implementations
Project management/planning software
Proficient in both Waterfall and Agile project management methodology
Advanced ability to analyze, design, and document processes
Highly Proficient in multi-tasking and managing multiple projects
Highly proficient in working in a projects-based, team environment
Highly Proficient in leveraging the competencies of project team and stakeholders to enhance project results
Goal driven and intrinsically motivated
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong customer service skills
Exceptional leadership and influencing skills
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong organization and time management skills
Highly proficient in working independently with minimal supervision
Flexible and adaptable to change
Comfortable working with all levels of corporate personnel

Preferred:
Minimum 1-3 years of experience with Jira
Minimum 1-3 years of experience with projects involving proprietary software solutions

At MODE, were dedicated to providing our employees with a working environment where they can flourish professionally and personally. You can expect an inclusive and supportive workplace where people help each other succeed. Our benefits package is exceptional, including medical, dental, and vision with flexible time off policies. We believe in the future of our employees, so we offer a generous match to your 401k plan. With locations all across the United States, you can join us in providing transportation and logistics solutions to our customers.

MODE Global is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Analyst
description:
The Vacancy

We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our project teams responsible for the IT separation of the De La Rue businesses. You will document existing business processes and help define new processes required during transition and separation, reviewing, and identifying areas for improvement. You will ensure consideration is given to requirements around IT audit and compliance. You will be critical to the success of a large programme of work including the separation of customer facing and back-office IT systems, End User/Desktop IT and Service Management, bridging the gap between business needs and technical implementation. You will be working IT and project teams to map them to tasks required to meet the separation programme’s aims.

Key Responsibilities
• You will build relationships across the business and manage stakeholder expectations and needs.
• Process mapping and analysis including gap analysis
• Requirements gathering
• Developing a clear understanding of As-Is processes, and working with stakeholders to develop a corresponding set of To-Be processes

Contract type: 12 Month Fixed Term Contract

Working hours: Full Time

Base location: Malta

Skills, Qualifications & Experience
• Educated to degree level or equivalent work experience.
• Demonstrable experience of Process and Business Analysis.
• Strong communication skills
• Excellent stakeholder management across the organisation
• Excellent listening skills and the ability to effectively challenge stakeholders to ensure progress is not blocked
• Process modelling
• Ability to organise and plan work for yourself and in support of other teams.
• Ability to work as part of a team.
• Ability to work with stakeholders across the organisation
• Ability to drive change through to completion, be creative and overcome obstacles / blockers to progress.
• Able to work independently
• Ability to produce documentation to a high standard
• Working with teams across several, often remote, locations
• Support effective project tracking

About De La Rue

De La Rue’s purpose is securing trust between people, businesses, and governments.

We operate across six continents to provide highly secure physical and digital solutions to 140 countries. As an authentication and currency provider we are the trusted partner of choice for governments, central banks and businesses seeking to secure their global supply chains and cash cycles.

Specialising in product design, international manufacturing, and digital solutions, we are trusted by governments, central banks and brands to provide secure products and services that protect economies, revenue sources and reputations. Our solutions enable businesses and people to participate securely in the global economy whilst protecting people from the impact of counterfeiting and illicit trade.

Benefits
• A competitive salary package
• Hybrid working opportunities
• 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
• A Medical Health Insurance for you and your dependents
• Well-being support and subsidy

Please note that applications are reviewed on a rolling basis and therefore interviews may be held prior to the closing date for this vacancy.
• This position is located in Malta. To be eligible for consideration, you must be authorised to work in Malta without sponsorship**

Join the Team

We want to work with people like you from all backgrounds and experiences, to help us gain a diverse workforce with a broad outlook and sharp expertise. We are looking for people unafraid to go that extra mile, bringing with them unique characteristics and abilities.

Show us you have what it takes and we'll reward you with a great place to work alongside other great people. Global business, global people. We think De La Rue is an amazing place to work. But don't just take our word for it.

Join The Team And Create Your Own Story

Working at De La Rue

Documents
