title: Advisory Solution Consultant, Intelligent Automation
description:
Company Description
It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today - ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
Job Description
As a member of our Solution Consulting team, you will have a major impact on our future success by supporting Employee Experience Solution Sales. You will guide revenue for one of our products with the support and partnership of Sales, Product Management, and the executive team. This is a hands-on technical consultant who can go wide and deep on solution delivery and solution positioning during sales cycles.
• Assist the greater SC organization with discovery and qualification of AI related sales opportunities within existing customers
• Provide deep knowledge, expertise, and thought leadership in support of the AI suite of capabilities on the ServiceNow platform
• Deliver product demos using compelling story telling based on business outcomes
• Execute hands on workshops in a variety of scenarios to customers based on existing sales opportunities
• Assist and educate your field SC and SSE counterparts on the value of our AI solutions, as well as guidance around the best ways to provide customers with validation of value
• Development of assets that can be used by the greater SC organization such as Demos, use cases, stories, competitive assets and more

What you get to do in this role:
• The Solution Consultant is a technical consultant with the advanced ability to develop, position and provide product-specific solutions during sales cycles while achieving quarterly and annual sales goals for an assigned territory.
• Support product sales as a technical and domain expert of a client-facing sales team
• Lead discovery workshops to determine customers' challenges and give product demonstrations to align our solution with customer needs
• Answer product feature and technical questions from customers, channel partners and ServiceNow colleagues
• Provide feedback to product management about product enhancements that can address customer needs and provide additional value
• Share and learn best practices and re-usable assets with other Solution Consultants to enhance the quality and efficiency of the team
• Stay current on competitive analysis and market differentiation
• Support marketing events including executive briefings, conferences, user groups, and trade shows

Qualifications
To be successful in this role you have:
• 7+ years of pre-sales solution consulting or sales engineering experience
• Proficiency with the ServiceNow platform or technical expertise with cloud software solutions
• Experience working collaboratively with product management, product marketing, partners, and professional services
• Territory management skills, including pipeline building and working with Sales counterpart to guide execution excellence
• Travel, as necessary

Not sure if you meet every qualification? We still encourage you to apply! We value inclusivity, welcoming candidates from diverse backgrounds, including non-traditional paths. Unique experiences enrich our team, and the willingness to dream big makes you an exceptional candidate!
Additional Information
Work Personas
We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here .
Equal Opportunity Employer
ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
Accommodations
We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
Export Control Regulations
For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Senior Consultant-FAW
description:
Accelalpha is a rapidly growing consultancy delivering Oracle Cloud Solutions to global clients. Despite the challenges faced over the last few years, Accelalpha continued to grow rapidly providing stability for our employees and customers. Accelalpha is proudly a Certified as a Great Place to Work and a Fortune 100 best workplace, and prides itself on a culture of support, diversity, and work life balance.

Accelalpha provides employees with the opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies and access to rapid career advancement.

Accelalpha's purpose is to help our clients solve critical business challenges through a unique approach to process improvement, solution design and project delivery. Our success is based on a proven implementation track record, industry leading domain expertise and unmatched talent in our delivery teams.

We are currently seeking for "Oracle FAW Sr. Consultant" position to join our team,

Experience: 5-8 years
Locations: Hyderabad/Bangalore/Pune
Employment Type: Full time

title: Network Engineer III (ON-SITE IN EDEN PRAIRIE, MN)
description:
Overview:

IDEMIA is the global leader in identity and security. Our mission is to create a safe and simple future where identity verification is indisputable, and only you can assert your identity. We are a distributed company leveraging the latest technologies to deliver world-class products in the private and public sectors of finance, telecom, identity, security, retail, sports entertainment, commercial, government, and IoT. We use a variety of technologies and approaches to deliver quality product and services to government agencies and technology companies. IDEMIA is a made up of a group of 14,000 diverse people from different nationalities, speaking over 20 different languages. Together, our solutions impact the everyday lives of citizens and nations. In this ever-changing world, protecting your identity is paramount. Join the team that is ensuring one person- one identity.

Responsibilities:
• Design and engineer data and voice network architecture and solutions to meet the growing and changing needs of Idemia.
• Configure, install and troubleshoot network technologies, such as routers, switches, and firewalls, including: configuring and troubleshooting routing (BGP), MPLS, SD-WAN and QOS.
• Working knowledge of local, wide area networks, and cloud technology.
• Strong Cisco router configuration and management, including monitoring and configuration tools; data circuit/WAN support; Ethernet topologies and data/voice communications.
• Very strong Cisco ASA/Firepower configuration and management.
• Experience designing and implementing Cisco ISE in an enterprise environment.
• Configure, install and troubleshooting voice systems, circuits, and phones, including configuring and troubleshooting call center technologies and advance call routing.
• Establish standards for documenting information systems and changes to them and for testing new systems and updates for current programs before they are put into production.
• Collaborates with IT team to implement technical controls and projects to ensure security issues are addressed.
• Efficiently manage oneself, resources, and timelines to deliver solutions that solve business needs and requirements
• Ensure the systems environment is reliable, secure and meets or exceeds regulatory agency compliance requirements.
• Collaborate with management and department leaders to assess near and long-term network capacity needs.
• Able to carry out job functions independently and responsibly.
• Strong interpersonal, written, oral communication skills.
• Available for 24/7 on-call support.

Qualifications:
• BA degree in computer science, MIS or related field.
• 5-7 years preferred IT experience.
• Proven experience and success with LAN / WAN/Cloud, design, implementation and support.
• Extensive knowledge of network automation.
• Experience deploying and operating on a public cloud framework, both Azure and AWS.
• Proven experience with network capacity planning, network security principles, and general network management best practices.
• Extensive knowledge of wireless design, implementation and support.
• Hands-on experience configuring and maintaining enterprise networks.
• Experience with implementing and maintaining network monitoring tools.

title: Network Engineer
description:
When you become part of our team, your career opportunities are endless. We offer our team members competitive compensation and world-class benefits. Our culture is easy to live, but hard to describe come see exactly what it means to be a part of High Point Networks.

High Point Networks is a leading provider of information technology solutions in both SMB and enterprise-level markets, servicing customers from coast to coast. We specialize in anything that spans your network, data center, phone system and endpoints with a strong security focus across all things IT. Our Headquarters is in West Fargo, North Dakota with additional regional offices throughout North Dakota, South Dakota, Minnesota, Montana, Nebraska, Oklahoma, and Colorado. No matter where your business is located within the United States, we have you covered.

Job Summary

The Network Engineer is responsible for the design and implementation of network infrastructure in customer environments, ensuring networks are running smoothly, upgrading networks to provide maximum performance as well as providing technical assistance to team members with system and network requests. The ideal candidate is interested in keeping up with current technologies, trends and best practices through educational opportunities, personal networks, and professional publications. You will be part of an engineering team responsible for the design and realization of scalable, highly available and maintainable solutions for High Point Networks clients.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Install, configure, and support LAN and WAN network equipment, knowledge of STP/RSTP/MSTP, OSPF, VRRP, 802.1x, switch stacking, multi-chassis LAG, QOS desired
Install, configure, and support enterprise wireless solutions, knowledge of controller-based and cloud solutions desirable
Install, configure, and support NGFW security solutions, including monitoring and management platforms
Ability to troubleshooting complex multi-vendor network issues in LAN and WAN networks
Assist with helpdesk support tickets and work directly with end users to resolve technical issues
Remote access solutions supporting IPSEC VPN and SSL-VPN, MFA experience desirable
Document network implementations in accordance with company standards
Minimum 3 years related experience
Other duties as required

Additional Duties and Responsibilities

Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively
Escalate service or project issues that cannot be completed within agreed service levels
Business awareness: specific knowledge of the customer and how IT relates to their business strategy and goals
Document internal processes and procedures related to duties and responsibilities
Responsible for entering time and expenses as it occurs
Understand processes by completing assigned training materials
Work through project tickets and phases as assigned by a Project Manager
Enter all work as service or project tickets into company ticketing system
Review IT publications and online materials to remain up-to-date with current and future technologies emerging in the industry
Participate in an on-call rotation

Knowledge, Skill and Abilities Required

Diagnostic skills of technical issues
Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly
Technical awareness: ability to match resources to technical issues appropriately
Service awareness of all organizations key IT services for which support is being provided
Understanding of support tools, techniques, and how technology is used to provide IT services
Typing skills to ensure quick and accurate entry of service request details
Self-motivated with the ability to work in a fast-moving environment

Knowledge of Technologies Desired but not Required

Palo Alto Networks: PCNSA, knowledge of Prisma Access and XDR solutions
Aruba Networks: ACSA/P, ACCA/P, ACMA/P, ACDA/P, Aruba Central
Juniper Networks: JNCIS-ENT, JNCIS-SEC
Extreme Networks: EXOS/VOSS, CloudIQ
Sonicwall: CSSA
Fortinet: NSE4+
qualifications: The ideal candidate is interested in keeping up with current technologies, trends and best practices through educational opportunities, personal networks, and professional publications, Minimum 3 years related experience, Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively, Escalate service or project issues that cannot be completed within agreed service levels, Diagnostic skills of technical issues, Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly, Technical awareness: ability to match resources to technical issues appropriately, Typing skills to ensure quick and accurate entry of service request details, Self-motivated with the ability to work in a fast-moving environment, Palo Alto Networks: PCNSA, knowledge of Prisma Access and XDR solutions

title: Network Engineer- 5596007
description:
Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

Key Responsibilities:
• Under limited supervision, performs one or more of the following Network Engineering activities: configuration management, system administration, security administration, network administration, development system implementation, production system implementation.
• Responds to issues related to environment, hardware, system, and/or software and implements resolution across technology areas.
• Supports multiple systems simultaneously, and provides leadership for large project efforts.
• Provide support or lead activities related to change management, outage management and/or project management.
• Provide LAN/WLAN/WAN support as needed, Oversight, Engineering Relationship, Field Service relationship, Collaboration among team.

Basic Qualifications:
• A minimum of 3 years of experience working in support of Cisco ACI networks
• High School Diploma or GED

Preferred Qualifications:

• SharePoint, Advanced Smartsheet, Excel, Visio Viewer, Word, OneNote, Secure CRT, ServiceMax, PDSM, Teams
• Experience with and understanding of the following
• 802.1Q, Access Control Lists, Access Points, CDP/LLDP, DHCP, DNS, EtherChannel, HSRP, IPv4, IPv6, MPLS, NAT, Network device configuration, Network troubleshooting, NTP, NXOS/IOS, Port Security, Routing Protocols (BGP, EIGRP), SD-WAN, Smartsheet, Spanning Tree Protocol (STP), Subnetting, TCP/UDP, TFTP/FTP, Virtual Port Channel, VLANs, VOIP, VRRP, WAN/LAN, WiFi, Wireless Security Protocols
• Experience with and understanding of Network device management access including Telnet, SSH, HTTP, HTTPS, console, TACACS+/RADIUS)
• Experience with multi-mode, single-mode fiber, fiber connector types, and copper cabling
• Experience with Cisco Modules such as NIM, PVDM, SFP, QSFP
• CCNA or CCNP Certification

title: Enterprise Network Engineer
description:
Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.

We are seeking a network engineer to install, configure, and support our internal network and data center. As part of a small team, you'll have the opportunity to evaluate technology and influence changes in Epic's internal infrastructure. Our global network environment is comprised of a variety of mainstream Cisco and other vendor hardware. You'll investigate and implement modern switching and routing platforms, configure firewall rules, and design and troubleshoot ISP and WAN connectivity. You'll also install and maintain internal WiFi campus networks, configure remote access connectivity, and architect modern, converged data center networks. With an increased focus on infrastructure as code for deployments, you'll also leverage technologies like Terraform and Ansible.

Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.

Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin, the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), the fittest city in America (Fitbit), and the third best metro in the US for young professionals (Forbes Advisor).

More than just important work.

Our uniquely themed campus was designed to heighten your ability to get stuff done in your office, a conference room, or by the fireplace in a comfy chair. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they’re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you’ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyoncé concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.

We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Healthcare is global, and building the best ideas from around the world into Epic software is a point of pride. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we know that inclusive teams design software that supports the delivery of quality care for all patients, so diversity, equity, and inclusion are written into our principles. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https://careers.epic.com/EEO.
• Bachelor's degree
• A history of academic and professional success
• Proficiency with Cisco enterprise hardware preferred; up-to-date CCNA or CCNP certification helpful
• Relocation to Madison, WI area (reimbursed)
• Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship
• COVID-19 vaccination
qualifications: A history of academic and professional success

title: Network Engineer II - 2nd Shift
description:
Network Engineer II (2nd Shift - Evening)
Department: Network Engineering
Reports to: Manager of Network Engineering
Career path: Network Architect
Job SummaryThe Network Engineer II is responsible for the operation, implementation, and maintenance of Atomic Data’s service provider network, as well as supporting all client network infrastructure. This role’s primary responsibility is to provide advanced technical support on network engineering activities, ensuring the design and implementation of robust and secure network solutions. Network Engineers work collaboratively within a team to manage customer networks, design/quote/build network architecture, and support a wide variety of client networks. Candidates must be adept at translating business requirements into technical specifications and anticipating end-to-end network infrastructure needs.

The ideal candidate will possess advanced knowledge of networking and server administration, along with expertise in the latest cybersecurity treads, platforms, and architectures. Additionally, this role involves providing escalation support for troubleshooting network issues escalated from the Network Operations Center (NOC) and other engineering teams.Essential Functions
• Build and maintain strong relationships with clients to understand their infrastructure needs and ensure satisfaction.
• Collaborate with the sales team in a presales capacity to present technical solutions to clients, demonstrating the value of proposed network architectures.
• Design, configure, and install custom infrastructure solutions for client networks and data centers.
• Provide advanced technical direction on network engineering activities, ensuring the design and implementation of robust and secure network solutions.
• Implement best practices for infrastructure design and management.
• Analyze, report and remediate network security breaches or attempted breaches.
• Develop and enforce network security policies and best practices to safeguard clients and the organization against cyber threats.
• Utilize industry-leading cybersecurity solutions from vendors such as Cisco, Fortinet, and Palo Alto Networks to implement network security measures.
• Implement and manage various routing protocols to optimize network traffic flow and performance, including OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP.
• Oversee the deployment of secure and efficient wireless networking solutions.
• Design and configure VPN solutions to ensure secure remote access for clients, employees and partners.
• Assess current network systems and recommend improvements to enhance performance and security.
• Perform routine maintenance or standard repairs to networking infrastructure.
• Collaborate with network engineers to troubleshoot and resolve complex network issues.
• Coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure successful project outcomes.
• Monitor industry websites and publications for updates on patches, releases, and potential vulnerabilities.
• Stay current with emerging infrastructure technologies and evaluate their potential impact for clients.
• Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing network engineering team.
• Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture, promoting continuous improvement.
Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science, along with 5+ years of professional network engineering experience; or advanced knowledge with 10+ years of experience in a high-performance infrastructure engineering environment, specifically in support and network services engineering responsibilities.
• Extensive experience with one or more the following:
• Security Appliances - Cisco ASA/FTD, Fortigate, Palo Alto
• Network Switching - Cisco Catalyst, Aruba AOS, Extreme
• Wireless - Cisco, Aruba, Extreme, Ruckus
• Network monitoring tools
• Network documentation
• 24x7 operations experience required
• Additional Requirements
• Must be willing to participate in a 24/7 On-call rotation, travel for work-related projects, and work occasional weekends when needed.
• Ability to lift heavy objects up to 50 lbs. unassisted
• Preferred Skills And Experience
• Industry Standard Certifications: CCNP, Fortinet Certified Professional, PCNSA - Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Admin, (CWNA) Certified Wireless Network Administrator, CISSP, JNCIP, AWS Solutions Architect
• Subject Matter Expert in one or more of the following:
• NAC - Cisco DNAC, Aruba Clearpass
• SASE solutions
• Zero-Trust Architecture
• Network Automation; DevOps
• Public cloud offerings - Azure, AWS, Google
• SIEM tools
• Proven experience with supporting data center infrastructure.
• Knowledge of Low Voltage wiring standards including both copper and fiber
• Knowledge of power & cooling implementation in a datacenter environment

title: Network Engineer
description:
About the position

Nystrom & Associates, Ltd. is seeking a dedicated Network Engineer to support and enhance the network infrastructure of the organization. This role is pivotal in planning, deploying, and maintaining networking equipment, ensuring that the network operates efficiently and securely. The Network Engineer will be involved in the daily operations of the network team, which includes configuring and installing network equipment, collaborating with vendors, and performing routine network maintenance. The responsibilities of the Network Engineer encompass managing and administering all aspects of the Nystrom network, including security and associated equipment such as routers, switches, and firewalls. A critical part of this role is to ensure that proper backups are completed and to make recommendations for upgrades and changes that align with the overall business goals. The Network Engineer will also be responsible for ensuring that secure networking practices are followed, coordinating remediation efforts when necessary, and implementing changes to enhance network security. In addition to these responsibilities, the Network Engineer will maintain up-to-date network diagrams that reflect both physical and logical layouts, including important data flows. This position requires coordination with internal security teams and business partners to conduct security assessments. The Network Engineer will also research, evaluate, and recommend networking hardware and software, including switches, firewalls, security appliances, remote access systems, and network management systems. Expanding network monitoring across the entire environment and maintaining vendor relationships are also key aspects of this role. The candidate must be adaptable and prepared for travel, as it may be required at short notice. Availability for on-call duties to provide network support and address urgent issues outside of regular business hours is essential, and after-hours maintenance may be necessary to minimize disruption during peak business hours. The position is full-time and on-site at the New Brighton, MN clinic, with the potential to transition to a hybrid model after approximately 90 days.

Responsibilities
• Manage and perform administration of all Nystrom network, security, and associated equipment (routers, switches, firewalls, etc.)
,
• Ensure proper backups are complete and make recommendations for upgrades and changes as needed to support overall business goals.
,
• Ensure secure networking practices are occurring and coordinate requirements for remediation when necessary.
,
• Implement changes to improve the networking environment and keep up with company requirements.
,
• Maintain up-to-date network diagrams for both physical and logical layouts, including important data flows.
,
• Coordinate with internal security teams and business partners regarding security assessments.
,
• Research, evaluate, and recommend networking hardware and software such as switches, firewalls, security appliances, remote access systems, and network management systems.
,
• Expand network monitoring across the entire environment.
,
• Maintain vendor relationships.
,
• Be adaptable and prepared for travel as needed at short notice.
,
• Be available for on-call duties to provide network support and address urgent issues outside of regular business hours.
,
• Perform special projects and other responsibilities as needed.

Requirements
• Experience with network administration and management of routers, switches, and firewalls.
,
• Strong understanding of network security practices and protocols.
,
• Ability to create and maintain network diagrams and documentation.
,
• Experience in coordinating with security teams for assessments and remediation efforts.
,
• Knowledge of networking hardware and software evaluation and recommendation processes.
,
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.

Nice-to-haves
• Experience with network monitoring tools and systems.
,
• Familiarity with cloud networking solutions.
,
• Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, or equivalent.

Benefits
• Opportunity to transition to a hybrid work model after 90 days.
,
• Full-time employment with a stable organization.
,
• On-site work environment at the New Brighton, MN clinic.
qualifications: Experience with network administration and management of routers, switches, and firewalls, Strong understanding of network security practices and protocols, Ability to create and maintain network diagrams and documentation, Experience in coordinating with security teams for assessments and remediation efforts, Knowledge of networking hardware and software evaluation and recommendation processes, Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure, Experience with network monitoring tools and systems, Familiarity with cloud networking solutions, Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, or equivalent

title: IT Technical Networking Engineer
description:
About Phaedon, LLC

At Phaedon, we are revolutionizing how companies engage with their audiences and are passionate about sparking participation to drive growth for both our clients and our employees. Phaedon is a data-driven, tech-enabled marketing organization with a breadth of capabilities that go beyond our competitors and redefine traditional industry archetypes. We have a history of delivering game-changing results for notable brands across advanced analytics, loyalty technology and services, marketing communications, and experience transformation to bring intelligent imagination and solve our clients’ biggest business and brand challenges. And every role at Phaedon has an integral part to play in fulfilling this vision.

Phaedon has IT Operations teams that are responsible for providing day-to-day technical IT operational support for our hosting platform, our client-facing products, and for the leading-edge technologies that enable our products. Our products provide services to the loyalty marketing industry. Examples of loyalty marketing programs include frequent flier and hospitality consumer programs.

We are looking for a motivated and accountable individual who ideally possesses a hybrid of skills including knowledge of IT infrastructure and the ability to execute and support IT Operations for the applications running in them. (Note: This is not deskside support.). This individual thrives in a fast-paced agile environment and desires to grow as the IT industry and technology evolve. A successful candidate is responsible for and will be able to lead small projects, triage IT incidents, mentor and lead junior staff, and effectively communicate to multiple levels of stakeholders. The individual is one who has the skills to not only perform the operational tasks but can also crosstrain others on it. Being a good team player is a must.

Key Responsibilities
• Design and support the implementation of AWS networking solutions, including VPCs, subnets, routing, and security groups.
• Monitor IT systems for optimal performance and capacity management.
• Provide support for ongoing network operations, including configuration management and network security.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize operational processes and ensure efficient resource utilization.
• Support continuous improvement initiatives including those around monitoring, alerting, incident response, and reporting on the health of our systems
• Support migration of technologies/tools to AWS
• Maintain documentation as part of a knowledge base
• Contribute to and support technology/tool lifecycle management including operationalizing new technologies
• Serve in rotation with a 24x7 on-call IT support team
• Mentor junior members of the team
• Work in an agile (SAFe) framework

Qualifications/Knowledge, Skills, Experience
• Strong understanding of AWS networking concepts and services (e.g., VPC, Route 53, Direct Connect).
• Strong triage skills for incident management
• Strong understanding of IT systems and how IT systems interact
• Must be extremely detail-oriented and possess organizational skills
• Experience with on-prem technologies such as switches, firewalls and hypervisors is a nice to have.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills including customer service skills
• Strong computer knowledge including the MS Office Suite, VPN and collaboration tools.
• Strong ability to multi-task, think, and react quickly
• Ability to learn and recommend new software tools and applications
• Ability to work independently and in support of senior leadership efforts
• Possess a strong spirit for continuous improvement
• Strong ability to mentor and provide leadership to junior staff
• College degree or equivalent experience
• 3+ years using infrastructure / networking monitoring and performance tools (e.g., AppDynamics, Splunk, CloudWatch, Wireshark)
• 3-5+ years experience working in an IT Operations setting
• Amazon Solutions Architect or Advanced Networking certification is recommended.

Phaedon is an equal opportunity employer, and all employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Reasonable Accommodations are available, including, but not limited to, for disabled veterans, individuals with disabilities, and individuals with sincerely held religious beliefs, in all phases of the application and employment process.

We value our employees and demonstrate this through our comprehensive benefits offering including medical/dental/vision coverage, comprehensive paid time off, paid holidays, paid parental leave, retirement savings plans, and more.

Pay Range - There are multiple factors that are considered in determining final pay for a position, including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location, education and certifications as well as contract provisions regarding labor categories that are specific to the position. The pay range for this position is: $102,000 - $138,000.

title: Cloud Network Engineer
description:
Recruitment Title: Cloud Network Engineer

Compensation: $125,000 - $135,000 (depending on experience)
• Please note, this position is not eligible for H-1B or Green Card sponsorship.

Position Overview:

The Office of Information Technology (OIT) at the University of Minnesota is seeking an experienced cloud network engineer to support the development and implementation of cloud technologies that advance our core mission of academics, research, and outreach. Candidates should have full lifecycle experience with hybrid clouds including: architecture/design, build, and ongoing operational support. This is an exciting opportunity to define and operationalize cloud services in Azure, Google Cloud, and/or AWS through robust automation and CI/CD pipelines. Ideal candidates will have excellent technical and interpersonal skills (elevated EQ), an ability to work with users and technologists with varying levels of experience and a strong commitment to supporting an environment of trust, collaboration, and mission-focused work.

We Offer:
• University paid contribution (10% of your salary) to your retirement account - vested immediately.
• 22 paid vacation days per year, in addition to sick leave and 11 paid holidays.
• Reduced tuition opportunities covering 75% - 100% of eligible tuition.
• Excellent and affordable health care benefits.
• Wellness program with opportunity to earn lower health care rates.
• Free disability insurance.
• Annual merit increase program.

Job Responsibilities:
• Advocate for and implement standardized cloud networking architecture tailored to the university's unique environment.
• Serve as the primary connector between the traditional network team and the cloud team, facilitating collaboration and understanding.
• Provide deep technical expertise and guidance on cloud network design, deployment, and maintenance.
• Promote the value and importance of cloud integration within the broader scope of the university's network strategy.
• Design and implement virtual private cloud (VPC) networks using cloud-native peering and traditional routing protocols
• Work alongside other cloud engineers to design, automate, and support Infrastructure Landing Zones in our various public cloud providers (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP, & OCI)
• Develop detailed technical processes and supporting documentation for cloud services
• Lead troubleshooting and service restoration efforts for cloud services
• Configure and fine-tune monitoring, alerting, and event management for cloud network services
• Plan and execute code upgrades for cloud network services
• Work with product owner and architect to define technical deliverables for requests and features based on internal stakeholder needs using Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and agile processes
• Please document qualifications on resume.

Required Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree and four years of related experience OR a comparable combination of education, training, and experience.
• Strong network engineering experience (Cisco route/switch, firewall, load balancing, DNS)
• Cloud networking experience in one or more platforms: Azure, AWS, Google, on-premise cloud
• Strong scripting skills (ability to write Bash script, Python, Terraform, etc.)
• Familiar with infrastructure as code concepts using CI/CD pipelines (development, staging and production).
• Experience in creating training materials and educating team members as well as technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience migrating legacy applications to cloud environments while adhering to cloud native standards.
• Cisco CCNA, CCNP, CompTIA Network+, or other network certifications
• Experience with FortiNet or other Enterprise Firewalls
• Experience with DNS, DHCP, and IP address management
• Experience with cloud-native DNS services
• Experience using network protocol analyzers such as Wireshark for troubleshooting
• Experience with log analysis, monitoring, alerting, and event management

The University of Minnesota is an Equal Opportunity Educator and Employer.

Company DescriptionThe University of Minnesota is among the largest public research universities in the country, offering undergraduate, graduate, and professional students a multitude of opportunities for study and research. University of Minnesota students benefit from extensive partnerships with world-renowned health centers, international corporations, government agencies, and arts, nonprofit, and public service organizations.

title: Cloud network engineer - local
description:
Position: Azure Cloud Network Engineer

Location: Minneapolis, MN (Hybrid)( Resource will be expected to be in the office 2 days per week minimum)

Duration: 2 Years contract

Client is seeking one full-time resource to assist the Network Operations Team with Azure Cloud network design, implementation, support, maintenance, and configuration of network Cloud infrastructure, including network switches, firewalls, load balancers, automation tools, monitoring, and troubleshooting. The position will also document design, and support and maintenance process and procedures and cross train current network staff on Cloud network tools and technologies.

Tasks

1. Design, plan, and implement client-specific cloud solutions, including private, public, and hybrid cloud infrastructures and on premise integrations

2. Design and implement network infrastructure, including routers, load balancers, switches, and firewalls

3. Develop detailed technical processes and supporting documentation for cloud services

4. Document design, implementation, and support and maintenance of Cloud infrastructure.

5. Cross train and mentor current staff on Cloud tools and technologies.

6. Work alongside other cloud engineers to design, automate, and support Infrastructure Landing Zones in our various Cloud providers

7. Work with product owner and architect to define technical deliverables for requests and features based on internal stakeholder needs using Agile Framework and agile processes

8. Provide knowledge transfer.

Desired Skills

1. Five (5) or more years of Cloud Network infrastructure design, implementation, and support.

2. Expert knowledge and skills in TCP/IP and network security, compliance, and best practice.

3. Ability to perform advanced technical issue analysis and troubleshooting within a Cloud infrastructure

4. Experience migrating legacy applications to cloud environments while adhering to cloud native standards

5. Strong network engineering experience (Cisco route/switch, firewall, load balancing, DNS)

6. Cloud networking experience in one or more platforms: Azure, AWS, Google, on premise cloud.

7. Strong analytical, oral and written communications, problem solving, and human relations skills.

8. Candidates should have full lifecycle experience with hybrid clouds including: architecture/design, build, and ongoing operational support

9. Experience in creating training materials and educating team members as well as technical stakeholders

10. Cisco CCNA, CCNP, CompTIA Network+, Checkpoint, or other network certifications

11. Experience using network protocol analyzers for configuring and fine-tune monitoring, alerting, and event management for cloud network services

Best Regards,

Chetna

title: Senior Network Engineer - Remote in MN or WI
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

Allina Health is a not-for-profit health system that cares for individuals, families and communities throughout Minnesota and western Wisconsin. If you value putting patients first, consider a career at Allina Health. Our mission is to provide exceptional care as we prevent illness, restore health and provide comfort to all who entrust us with their care. This includes you and your loved ones. We are committed to providing whole person care, investing in your well-being, and enriching your career.

As a member of the larger IT Infrastructure team, provide technical support for system-wide data and voice networks. This position requires knowledge of multiple systems including network circuits, routers, switches, wireless infrastructure, UPS’s and other power management systems, as well as voice and contact center systems and applications. May mentor lower-level engineers as requested. Will provide service that requires an understanding of the customers technical and business environment. Will include on-call rotation requiring work outside regular business hours. Partner with teams across IT to develop integrated solutions.

If you are located in MN or WI, you will have the flexibility to work remotely* as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:
• System administration and documentation
• Work primarily remote, but may need to be on site approximately 30% as business needs require
• Responsible for complex configuration and maintenance of voice and data network equipment and applications
• Install, maintain and support data and voice networks and related applications.
• Document supported network and telecommunications systems following defined documentation standards
• Provide expertise in the development of technical standards and operational procedures
• Participate in planning and engineering of network and telecommunications systems
• Maintaining and troubleshooting vendor network circuits
• Work across IT to develop integrated solutions for customer needs
• Diagnose and resolve voice and data customer issues
• Proactively identify customer issues with familiarity to their technical and business environment
• Provide on-call support which may result in working outside of regular business hours
• Other duties as assigned

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:
• 5+ years of experience supporting network infrastructure and technology
• Ability to work on call
• Ability to work outside of standard daytime hours as the business requires
• Ability to travel to Allina sites in the Twin Cities and out of state areas as needed

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or related field
• Cisco technical certification
• Experience with Cisco ACI
• Experience with Cisco SDA architecture
• Experience with Cisco platforms: Cisco Catalyst 9300, 9400, 9500 switches. Cisco Nexus switches, 4000 and 8000 series routers
• Cisco wireless infrastructure experience, including 9800 controllers
• Ekahau design experience
• Experience with routing protocols and WAN architecture
• DAS (Distributed Antenna Systems) experience
• All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.

The salary range for this role is $89,800 to $176,700 annually based on full-time employment. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Systems Administrator, Senior (MSO)
description:
Systems Administrator/Mission Support Operator - $10K Sign-on bonus
• Classified work and therefore must be on-site*

Mission Support Operator (MSO) provides 24/7, 365, 12hrs shift, Tier 1/2 operational support to end customers and users in the field/worldwide.
• Monitor the performance and capacity of end-to-end IT computer systems using a variety of specialized software applications/tools.
• Triage hardware, software, and environmental faults, alerts or malfunctions.
• When an issue is identified, the MSO works to determine the cause of the problem, provide situational awareness and resolution to the user community.
• Serve as first responder and ‘one-stop shop' for all site issues, requiring a broad level of knowledge of high priority systems across a multi-location enterprise.
• This is similar to a civilian Emergency Operations Center for Police/Sheriff Department but it is not the same; however, we action 911 notifications.
• This is not a traditional Network Engineer or System Administration role; however, having either background speeds up training so you can be proficient in 6 – 12 months.
• This role is "mission critical"; therefore are demanding and challenging. This is NOT a role that can be trusted to be performed in a remote capacity, must be ON SITE.
• Person we seek must have a solid Information Technology foundation.
• Panama Shift Schedule | 24/7 Shift Coverage.
• Panama Shift is a rotating shift pattern that uses multiple teams and two 2-hr shifts to provide 24/7 coverage. The working and non-working days typically follow this pattern: 2 days on, 2 days off, 3 days on, 3 days off. Each team may work the same shift (day or night) for 2-3 months then switches over to the other shift for the next 2-3 months. The rotation helps ensure equity regards to work life balance for all members of team.

Other duties include:
• Monitoring, recognition, evaluation, and correction of IT systems, network and satellite ground stations. ​
• Interfacing with the user community, Mission Directors, System Administrators, Network Engineers, external sites and other system operators as required for real-time detection, isolation, and resolution of problems.
• 24/7/365 Operational Support to customers and users in the field
• Utilize SolarWinds, Splunk, WireShark (and other monitoring tools) to monitor internal and external hardware, software, network connectivity, status IT infrastructure (utilizing ping, SNMP traps, customer scripts) – and utilizing established TTP's to respond to issues
• Provide support to Networking team, including Layer 1/2/3 type activities and documentation/design.​
• Perform analysis (in both real-time and post-event) on key mission capabilities and provide feedback to internal and external customers.​
• Maintain a positive, professional and helpful working relationship with our customers.​
• Perform daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly functional checks on systems and capabilities, also perform inspections on critical hardware and infrastructure.​
• Provide support to the Engineering staff for testing and validation of new software releases and network connections.​
• Support Configuration Management functions (Incidents, Assets) utilizing BMC Remedy.​
• Respond to customer voice and electronic support requests.​
• Respond to real time, mission critical situations (response defined in minutes).​
• Participate in internal and external scheduled exercises.​
• Create, maintain, and update SOP/TTP documentation

Required Qualifications
• 8+ years of directly related experience in IT / Network administration and support.
• TS/SCI or DoE Q Clearance
• Experience with monitoring tools such as SolarWinds, Splunk, or WireShark.
• Have a working knowledge of critical physical infrastructure (including HVAC, Power, UPS, etc) that is utilized to support mission operations

Desired Qualifications
• Experience with Linux and Windows system administration and networking background is preferable.

Required Education/Certifications
• DoD 8570 Compliant Certifications are required

title: Lead Systems Administrator
description:
Title:
Lead Systems Administrator

This is a hybrid opportunity.

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking a Lead Systems Administrator to support our NASA Aeronautics Research Technology and Simulation (ARTS) Program for KBR’s Science and Space division. The purpose of ARTS Program is to provide mission critical support for researchers with high-fidelity environments to conduct simulated flight and Air Traffic Management (ATM) research and advance the state-of-the-art simulation technology. Researchers use the facilities to investigate a variety of topics ranging from the design of new aircraft guidance and control systems to the human factors implications of new or existing flight deck displays, airspace operations, air traffic control and automation.

The Lead Systems Administrator will lead a team of 4-5 System Administrators at the NASA Ames Research Center (ARC) Simulation Laboratories (SimLabs), where they manage, maintain, and enhance the complex IT systems and networks that support the SimLabs simulation system enterprise. Operating systems supported include Mac OS, Windows, and Linux, running on numerous devices and networks. The NASA ARC SimLabs consist of the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), with a 60 ft. vertical motion system and interchangeable cabs, which can be customized to simulate any aerospace vehicle; the Crew Vehicle Systems Research facility (CVSRF), which houses the B747-400 flight simulator; and Future Flight Central (FFC), an Air Traffic Control/Air Traffic Management (ATC/ATM) simulation facility dedicated to solving present and emerging capacity problems of the nation's airports.

The work will be performed at the NASA AMES Research Center Simulation Laboratories in Mountain View, California.

The Lead Systems Administrator will be responsible for:
• Leading a team of 4-5 system administrators to maintain and enhance the IT systems and networks that run under Windows, Linux, and that support the SimLabs simulation system enterprise.
• Performing IT security plan management and administration and system and network management and administration.
• Performing troubleshooting and resolution, user support, planning and implementation of software and hardware upgrades, regular backups of systems, restoration as required, development and deployment of new capabilities, implementation of NASA IT security policy, and interface to external organizations and laboratories for networking, VPN provision, and data exchange.
• Developing customized solutions to address individual researcher needs for data collection, fusion, and processing.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
• Education: Must have a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent
• 5-10 years of experience in IT systems administration, software development, computer engineering, or other related fields
• Expertise in managing networks to comply with an IT Security Plan including management of isolated network equipment (firewalls, routers, switches, DNS)
• Experience with IT security benchmark compliance and maintenance
• Expertise in IT Management of Linux (Ubuntu, Oracle Linux 8), Mac OS, and Windows systems
• Strong system debugging skills
• Excellent problem solving, communications, organizational, and leadership skills
• Deadline and detail-oriented
• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
• Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and configuration management tools such as Puppet, Ansible, and Terraform
• Experience with IT support ticket systems such as Remedy and JIRA
• Understanding of logging systems and client-end configuration tools such as Splunk and Graylog
• Familiarity with elements of Cloud Computing and Amazon Web Services
• Understanding of modern Data Center infrastructure, including racking and stacking of hardware and network configuration

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
• Prior experience supporting a NASA contract
• Knowledge of NASA’s IT security requirements or experience managing systems to compliant with NIST standards
• Experience or interest in enhancing knowledge and skills in AI, cloud and other developing technologies
• Experience with real-time systems
• Familiar with managing Atlassian enterprise system
• Working knowledge of Python or other scripting languages

Basic Compensation:

$138,900 - $208,400

This range is for the California area only

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR BENEFITS

KBR offers a wide range of benefits for their employees; we offer medical, prescription, dental, vision, AD&D, disability benefits, retirement 401k, travel benefits, PTO, holidays, flexible work schedules, parental leave, military leave, education assistance, and the list goes on and on! We also support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Classified Windows Systems Administrator - ACTIVE SECURITY CLEAR Jobs
description:
Additional Information

#LI-Onsite

Position Information

This is a Career Indefinite position, open to Lab employees and external candidates.

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?
• Included in 2024 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
• Flexible Benefits Package
• 401(k)
• Relocation Assistance
• Education Reimbursement Program
• Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
• Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Accountability (IDEA) - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity
• Our core beliefs - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/our-values
• Employee engagement - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/employee-engagement

Security Clearance

This position requires an active Department of Energy (DOE) Q-level clearance or active Top Secret clearance issued by another U.S. government agency at time of hire.

Pre-Employment Drug Test

External applicant(s) selected for this position must pass a post-offer, pre-employment drug test. This includes testing for use of marijuana as Federal Law applies to us as a Federal Contractor.

Wireless and Medical Devices

Per the Department of Energy (DOE), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory must meet certain restrictions with the use and/or possession of mobile devices in Limited Areas. Depending on your job duties, you may be required to work in a Limited Area where you are not permitted to have a personal and/or laboratory mobile device in your possession. This includes, but not limited to cell phones, tablets, fitness devices, wireless headphones, and other Bluetooth/wireless enabled devices.

If you use a medical device, which pairs with a mobile device, you must still follow the rules concerning the mobile device in individual sections within Limited Areas. Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities require separate approval. Hearing aids without wireless capabilities or wireless that has been disabled are allowed in Limited Areas, Secure Space and Transit/Buffer Space within buildings.

How to identify fake job advertisements

Please be aware of recruitment scams where people or entities are misusing the name of Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) to post fake job advertisements. LLNL never extends an offer without a personal interview and will never charge a fee for joining our company. All current job openings are displayed on the Career Page under "Find Your Job" of our website. If you have encountered a job posting or have been approached with a job offer that you suspect may be fraudulent, we strongly recommend you do not respond.

To learn more about recruitment scams: https://www.llnl.gov/sites/www/files/2023-05/LLNL-Job-Fraud-Statement-Updated-4.26.23.pdf

Equal Employment Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

We invite you to review the Equal Employment Opportunity posters which include EEO is the Law and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.

Reasonable Accommodation

Our goal is to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates applying and interviewing at the Laboratory. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please use our online form to submit a request.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

title: Event Broadcast Systems Administrator
description:
Summary
Posted: Nov 12, 2024
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200566079

We want the World to be a better place! Join our team and imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. You bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish!

Do you enjoy understanding the intricacies of how things work and finding ways to make them even better? Are you enthusiastic about driving advancements in ground breaking technologies and products? If so, we'd love to hear from you!

Apple's Worldwide Events Team informs the world about Apple, our innovative products and services, and the values that drive our company. The team includes professionals with backgrounds in event design, media production, operations, and management. We’re looking for inventive, collaborative professionals accustomed to working in a technical environment on which high-profile creative projects depend. If that’s you, then your next home may be with us.

Description

Description
We're seeking a Broadcast Systems Administrator who will bring new technologies and methodologies that improve and evolve our ability to connect with Apple’s key audiences. You demonstrate attention to detail, clarity of thought, integrity, and creative approaches to difficult challenges. You have a highly developed sense of quality, accountability, and collaboration. You are dedicated to delighting partners, employees, and customers while innovating down to the details to deliver extraordinary virtual experiences.

In this role you will be challenged to work on advanced broadcast technologies, learn how Apple's latest features and technologies function, and collaborate with teams across the Software, Hardware, and Marketing organizations.

Additional responsibilities include:

Drive the design, enhancements, and expansion of existing media network systems in collaboration with Broadcast Team members.

Document technical procedures, signal flows, and network appliance configurations.

Establish standard methodologies and provide support for Apple Worldwide Events across its portfolio of production facilities and event venues.

Install and maintain servers, high-performance broadcast and storage equipment including encoders, media playback systems, and system-monitoring tools.

Collaborate with Apple Information Security and New Product Security teams to ensure all security measures are in place. Monitor vulnerabilities, deploy patches, address hardware related critical issues, and manage system updates.

Maintain local networks, file systems, and user accounts ensuring smooth operation and accessibility.

Foster relationships with industry leaders to keep apace with trends in the event and broadcast technology space.

Minimum Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
• 7+ years validated experience in an enterprise technical support role at a media production facility.
• Broad systems administration experience with three key platforms: macOS, Linux, and Windows.

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications
• Possess a broad knowledge of media, network, and computing technologies.
• Strong networking skills and the ability to handle sophisticated network infrastructures in a corporate environment.
• Meticulous approach to troubleshooting protocols and system upgrades, ensuring resilience, minimal downtime, and system reliability.
• Validated knowledge and hands-on experience with video-over-IP technologies including SMPTE 2110.
• Strong communication and diplomacy skills; capable of explaining work to audiences with various levels of technical experience.
• Experience with project management in order to navigate mixed priorities from key partners.
• Proven experience supporting technical teams during live, high-stakes global events.
• Certification in Cisco networking.
• Basic proficiency in scripting languages such as Python.
• Examples of having developed custom tools.
• Capacity to rapidly learn and master new technologies.
• BA/BS or equivalent meaningful experience.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

Pay & Benefits

Pay & Benefits
• At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,100 and $216,900, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

More
• Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.
qualifications: You demonstrate attention to detail, clarity of thought, integrity, and creative approaches to difficult challenges, You have a highly developed sense of quality, accountability, and collaboration, 7+ years validated experience in an enterprise technical support role at a media production facility, Broad systems administration experience with three key platforms: macOS, Linux, and Windows

title: System Administrator 1
description:
Your Future at M.C. Dean

We're seeking people driven to excellence and inspired to have a meaningful impact powering, automating, integrating, and securing the world’s most critical infrastructure and facilities. This translates into fulfilling opportunities for employees driven to excel in a meaningful career. As an employee at M.C. Dean, you will join forces with more than 5,800 professionals who engineer and deploy automated, secure and resilient power and technology systems; and deliver the management platforms essential for long-term system sustainability. Together, we transform the way complex, large-scale systems are designed, delivered, and sustained–enhancing client outcomes, improving lives, and changing the world for the better.

We are seeking a System Administrator 1 to join our Security and Electronic Systems (SES) business Unit. As part of (SES) Strategic Business Unit you will be part of a team that designs, engineers, integrates, operates and maintains electronic security services inclusive of intrusion detection, access control, biometric authentication, video surveillance, audio visual, it systems, perimeter defense and command and control systems for federal, local and commercial customers across high-growth markets.

Clearance/Citizen Type: No Clearance Required.

Work Type: Full-time

What you’ll do:

In this role, you will be responsible for monitoring, maintaining, and testing Physical Access Control, CCTV, PSIM, and other Integrated Electronic Systems. This is an on-site position, based at a single location. The ideal candidate will have flexibility in their schedule, maintain a neat appearance, and demonstrate the ability to communicate professionally with both customers and coworkers. Key factors for success include punctuality, consistent attendance, a willingness to learn, and strong teamwork skills.

Essential responsibilities and activities include but are not limited to:
• Manage physical security system support to meet service level agreements.
• Analyze physical security system performance and recommend improvements.
• Resolve complex system issues for physical security systems and networks.
• Triage customer support calls, providing Tier 1 help desk support and Tier 2 escalation.
• Communicate with customers, manufacturers, vendors, and technical specialists.
• Train system users and other system support personnel.
• Analyze and modify preventive maintenance checklists for system changes.
• Troubleshoot system performance issues and implement corrective actions.
• Perform preventive maintenance actions including system back-ups, error log reviews, database size, and integrity checks.
• Organize and prepare detailed documentation of system performance, including service request records and analysis.
• Perform desktop hardware and operating system set-up, imaging software loading, and antivirus updates.
• Perform all duties with minimal direct supervision.

Key Requirements:

Position / Candidate Requirements
• Education: 6+ years of experience with a High School Diploma or 1+ years with a Bachelor's in Engineering.

Required Progressive Experience:
• Requires the ability to work flexible shifts that may include occasional nights, weekends and holidays
• 1+ years of experience in troubleshooting access control hardware issues.
• 1+ years of experience in troubleshooting access control application issues
• 1+ years of experience in other physical security systems such as: Video management, Key box, Visitor management, PSIM
• 1+ years of experience in developing root cause analysis documentation or developing instructional guides on how to install/configure access control hardware

Preferred/Desired
• Experience in iStar replacement projects
• CCURE inst/main certified
• CCURE Adv Integrator certified
• FLIR Certified
• Genetec Certified

What we offer:
• A collaborative team inspired by the way engineering and innovation enhance customer outcomes, improve lives, and change the world for the better. We are driven by our core values of agility, expertise, and trust.
• An opportunity to lead and build a business with the support of an industry-leading firm that has been in business for 75 years.
• Investment in your skills and expertise through a combination of professional and technical training programs, including leadership training and tuition reimbursement.
• Open and transparent communication with senior leadership as well as local office management.

All information in this job posting has been designed to indicate the general nature of work to be performed. It is not designed to be all inclusive or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, abilities, and qualifications required of this position.

We offer an excellent benefits package including
• A competitive salary
• Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
• Paid-time off
• Tuition reimbursement
• 401k Retirement Plan
• Military Reserve pay offset
• Paid maternity leave

Pay Range: $72,150 - $115,440

Abilities
• Exposure to computer screens for an extended period of time.
• Sitting for extended periods of time.
• Reach by extending hands or arms in any direction.
• Have finger dexterity in order to manipulate objects with fingers rather than whole hands or arms, for example, using a keyboard.
• Listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
• Communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
• Read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
• Apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
• Identify and understand the speech of another person.

Applicants for this position may be required to obtain or provide proof of flu shots or of other vaccinations depending on customer requirements and nature of the position or demonstrate a valid basis for exception.

EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
VEVRAA Contractor
