title: Cloud Architect - 5491569
description:
Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Cloud Architect, you will be responsible for originating, solutions, and partnering across Accenture & the ecosystem to sell and deliver cloud change programs. You will work closely with the client to understand their cloud transformation and the impacts, and customize a change solution to their unique needs. Leveraging our framework and assets, you will accelerate the benefits of cloud by transforming the culture, organization, and talent. Additionally, you will create a value-focused pricing strategy and estimate the total value of Cloud Change work. As a SME, you will collaborate and manage the team to perform, making team decisions and engaging with multiple teams to contribute on key decisions. You will also provide solutions to problems for your immediate team and across multiple teams. You will need advanced proficiency in Cloud Computing. You will need AWS Devops, Cloud Strategy and Assessment, DevOps, and Kubernetes are recommended skills for this role, all with advanced proficiency. You will Develop innovative strategies to drive cloud change programs and deliver exceptional results. You will collaborate with clients to understand their cloud transformation needs and customize change solutions. You will be expected to leverage our framework and assets to accelerate the benefits of cloud by transforming culture, org, and talent. You will be expected to create value-focused pricing strategies and estimate the total value of Cloud Change work. You will be expected to lead and manage a team to ensure successful delivery of cloud change programs

Basic Qualifications:
• Minimum 4 years of AWS experience
• Minimum 4 years of Kubernetes experience
• Minimum 4 years of Banking experience
• Minimum 4 years of DevOps experience
• HS Diploma / GED

Preferred Qualifications:
• Good Communication
• Client facing experience
• Team work

Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Maryland, New York or Washington as set forth below.

We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.

Information on benefits is here.

Role Location Hourly Salary Range

California $51.54 - $61.54

Colorado $51.54 - $61.54

District of Columbia $51.54 - $61.54

New York $51.54 - $61.54

Maryland $51.54 - $61.54

Washington $51.54 - $61.54

About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent- and innovation-led company with 750,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology and leadership in cloud, data and AI with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients reinvent and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com

What We Believe

We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement

Requesting An Accommodation

Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.

If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.

Other Employment Statements

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

California requires additional notifications for applicants and employees. If you are a California resident, live in or plan to work from Los Angeles County upon being hired for this position, please click here for additional important information.

title: Cloud Security Architect Senior Consultant
description:
Are you looking to elevate your cyber career? Your technical skills? Your opportunity for growth? Deloitte's Government and Public Services Cyber Practice (GPS Cyber Practice) is the place for you! Our GPS Cyber Practice helps organizations create a cyber minded culture and become stronger, faster, and more innovative. You will become part of a team that advises, implements, and manages solutions across five verticals: Strategy, Defense and Response; Identity; Infrastructure; Data; and Application Security. Our dynamic team offers opportunities to work with cutting-edge cyber security tools and grow both vertically and horizontally at an accelerated rate. Join our cyber team and elevate your career.

Work you'll do
• Set up and manage access to cloud resources using accounts, users, and groups. He/she should be knowledgeable about potential vulnerabilities of virtual machines and container deployment systems.
• Will drive adherence to federal and state compliance requirements by overseeing continuous monitoring activities and incident response.
• Provides oversight over the implementation of approved security architecture/policies/procedures for a portfolio clients and engagements Initiate and conduct project security reviews to identify cloud infrastructure security risks
• Reviews and oversee the implementation of approved recommendations on cloud security design and implementation
• Support clients with data protection, IoT, and overarching cloud capabilities.
• Implement core and cloud infrastructure security to manage risks and exposure.
• Perform cyber reconnaissance to illuminate a potential attack surface area.
• Provide threat and vulnerability management to federal clients and teams.
• Analyze tactical network architectures and topologies to assess security risks.
• Responsible for architecting, deploying, configuring, and maintaining security baselines within the Azure/ Google Cloud and/or AWS cloud environment.
• Integrate cloud-native and/or third-party security services into new and existing cloud architectures.

The team

Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of more than 15,000 professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise

At Deloitte, we believe cyber is about starting things-not stopping them-and enabling the freedom to create a more secure future. Cyber Infrastructure is focused on rethinking how security is integrated across modernized infrastructure as cyber threats become more complex. If you're seeking a career implementing, architecting, and-in select cases-handling next generation controls to manage security risks and exposure, then the Cyber Infrastructure team at Deloitte is for you.

Required:

• Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.
• Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role.
• Expected to co-locate in your designated office/USDC location up to 30% of the time.
• Must live in a commutable distance to or be willing to relocate to one of the following Delivery locations: Atlanta, GA; Charlotte, NC; Dallas, TX; Gilbert, AZ; Houston, TX; Lake Mary, FL; Mechanicsburg, PA; Philadelphia, PA
• The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 3 years of experience in:
• Developing and updating cloud templates, standards, and best practices to be used by multiple cloud projects
• Strong foundation across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and/or Amazon AWS technology stack
• Standardizing Azure/ Google Cloud and/or AWS Security best practices, processes, and procedures
• Providing strategic and technical leadership for client teams establishing cloud infrastructure design, migrating data centers to cloud, developing infrastructure as code, or deploying cloud solutions
• Designing, and integrating marketplace leading vulnerability management, threat management, monitoring, and data protection processes and platform tools
• Building and operating automated security operations
• Experience implementing Azure, Google Cloud or AWS
• Designing and advising against security requirements to support cloud migration efforts
• Strong knowledge of industry trends in security technology
• Combining cloud-native and/or third-party security services to build comprehensive security architectures

Preferred:
• Prior professional services or federal consulting experience
• A history of delivering secure architectures in a federal/state environment
• Cloud architect certifications in Azure, Google Cloud or AWS
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to partner and collaborate with both engineers and business users on architecture vision and security model
• A comprehensive understanding of writing KQLs, and the use of PowerShell to write queries in all cloud platform

title: AVP - Sr. Cloud Architect
description:
About the position

The Enterprise Cloud Architect will be responsible for managing our company's cloud architecture and setting the strategic direction for the enterprise footprint in cloud environments. The ideal candidate will have an advanced understanding of cloud computing and platforms, as well as experience in large-scale migration and modernization of applications from on-premise deployments to the cloud. You should have a positive attitude and excellent communication skills, written and verbal, to effectively share your knowledge. This individual will oversee the strategy and roadmap for the overall cloud technology architecture and will ensure that the appropriate considerations are made for Agility, Security, Operational Efficiency, Quality, and leverage of cloud-native capabilities. The Architect will also be responsible for ensuring that the cloud technology investments are aligned to the organization's technology and governance strategies, policies, and standards. This role can have a Hybrid or Remote work arrangement. Candidates who live near one of our office locations (Hartford, CT; Stamford, CT; Danbury, CT; Charlotte, NC; Chicago, IL; Columbus, OH) will have the expectation of working in an office 3 days a week (Tuesday through Thursday). Candidates who do not live near an office will have a remote work arrangement, with the expectation of coming into an office as business needs arise.

Responsibilities
• Develop and oversee enterprise cloud strategy, including technology standards, cloud product usage, and development and deployment patterns across all enterprise technology domains (e.g., cloud, infrastructure, security, data, and applications) ensuring alignment with the business strategy.
,
• Analyze emerging industry business and technology cloud trends, translating implications for new capabilities into functional and technology domain planning.
,
• May have supervisory responsibility in instructing, assigning, directing, and checking the work of the resources within their section/department.
,
• Educate and influence stakeholders to promote simplification, risk management, and innovation of the cloud technology portfolio.
,
• Work with extended architecture, business, and IT support teams to develop functional and technical blueprints to deliver functional and automation change agenda aligned with strategic direction for HIG Lines of Business.
,
• Ensure Reliability Engineering & Automation CoE automation strategy implements scalable, reusable, and integrated solutions.
,
• Responsible for cloud architecture governance to ensure projects are compliant with IT strategy, architecture standards, and technology directions.
,
• Assists management with investment prioritization and architecture metrics at the Enterprise level.
,
• Work with the cloud vendors to evaluate and select services that can support business requirements.
,
• Train and share cloud knowledge with IT technical teams providing them cloud architectural consulting expertise, direction and assistance.
,
• Document and implement cloud standards for adopting cloud services for consistency.

Requirements
• Prior experience with large-scale cloud migration and cloud-native development.
,
• Experience with delivery methodologies such as Agile and SCRUM.
,
• Experience designing available Public Cloud services for enterprise consumption.
,
• Negotiation skills and ability to influence others by educating and sharing information.
,
• Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
,
• Migrating legacy solutions to cloud is a plus.
,
• Knowledge of all components of holistic enterprise architecture.
,
• Expert knowledge of computing architectures.
,
• Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture discipline and frameworks.
,
• Strong understanding of Cloud service offerings and capabilities.
,
• Clear understanding of cloud and container deployment architectures including building cloud-ready applications and container orchestration systems.
,
• Building and maintaining relationships with enterprise leaders to understand current and emerging business needs.
,
• Leading, influencing, and driving change across the enterprise with experience transforming large organizations.
,
• Bachelor's degree required (or experience equivalent).
,
• 10+ years' experience managing and directing medium to large-scale, multi-project development teams, or equivalent combination of education and work experience, ideally within the insurance and financial services industry.
,
• Demonstrated complex planning, conceptual, consulting and communication skills, analytical ability, strong judgment and management skills.
,
• Ability to interact with senior Hartford line of business area, IT management, and staff.

Nice-to-haves
• Experience with cloud-native application development frameworks.
,
• Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools.
,
• Knowledge of regulatory compliance in cloud environments.

Benefits
• Competitive salary range of $180,000 - $270,000 based on experience and performance.
,
• Short-term or annual bonuses and long-term incentives.
,
• On-the-spot recognition programs.
,
• Comprehensive health insurance coverage.
,
• 401(k) retirement savings plan with company matching contributions.
,
• Paid time off and holidays.
,
• Professional development opportunities and training programs.

title: Teamcenter Cloud Architect - REMOTE
description:
We are a leading global software company dedicated to the world of computer aided design, 3D modeling and simulation- helping innovative global manufacturers design better products, faster! With the resources of a large company, and the energy of a software start-up, we have fun together while creating a world class software portfolio. Our culture encourages creativity, welcomes fresh thinking, and focuses on growth, so our people, our business, and our customers can achieve their full potential.

Position Overview:

Cloud Application Services ITAR Operations team is looking for Product Architect role. Person would be responsible for deployments on specific cloud platforms/container platforms,
participating in all phases of the development, deployement and operational activities for Siemens ITAR customer's workloads

Experience:

• Minimum 8 years Teamcenter or other PLM/ALM experience, with at least 5 years supporting a customer Production environment deployments

Responsibilities:
• Configure and maintain containerized and non-containerized cloud hosted solutions
• Configure and manage monitoring, logging, alerting around infrastructure and applications
• Improving the reliability of cloud hosted SaaS Solution and CI/CD pipeline deployments
• Manage the production environment by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health with ongoing deployments
• Ensure customer workloads are configured and deployed properly and working as per SLA
• Support customer workload health and uptime round the clock configured using alerts
• Configure the Application Performance monitoring Alerts and PagerDuty alerts
• Solve application specific tickets
• Apply application & infrastructure patches on test, Preproduction and Production Server
• Install and configure application & infrastructure on Development, test, Preproduction and Production environment
• Configure and manage third parties deployed on environment
• Document root cause analysis of issues
• Reach out to Siemens GTAC for Product Issues and raise IRs
• Communicate with customer and internal stakeholders on issue resolution
• Provide workarounds to issues
• Develop Knowledge Management database for solved issues

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
• Proactive, emphatic and approachable.
• Team player and problem solver.
• Effective communicator.
• Great attitude but a critical thinker.
• Creative and open minded.
• Degree in Computer Science or related field (Master / Bachelor level); Minimum experience 5 years
• Knowledge of systems (Linux, GNU tooling), networking (OSI model, DNS, routing) and virtualization and containerization
• Security & Compliance awareness
• Hands-on experience with Siemens PLM, ALM, MOM &/or CAD tools preferred
• Public clouds; AWS/Azure/GCP experience & certification preferred
• Teamcenter Installation in a distributed environment
• Teamcenter custom template install using BMIDE
• Distributed FMS configuration
• Dispatcher configuration
• Active Workspace Installation and Configuration
• NX and Solidedge CAD Integration
• Working experience in Perl/Batch Scripts

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
• AWS or similar Cloud platform knowledge
• Experience with MCAD & ECAD Integration with Teamcenter or similar PLM
• knowledge of SQL Scripting
• knowledge of deploying customization and configuration on Production environment
• Mentoring of junior team members
• Use Pareto or 5 Why or any other Industry technique for root cause analysis
• Ability to automate some of the repetitive tasks
• Scripting knowledge would be useful

Security Clearance:

This position will be subject to U.S. export control requirements under the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or Export Administration Regulations (EAR). Employment is contingent on either verifying the U.S. Person status or obtaining any necessary export license.

Why us?

Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.

A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us shape tomorrow!

Siemens Software. Transform the Everyday

title: Principal Cloud Architect
description:
About the position

As a Principal Cloud Architect at Honeywell, you will be at the forefront of leading the strategic planning, design, and implementation of infrastructure solutions with a specific focus on Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A). This pivotal role requires a thorough analysis of the existing IT and cloud infrastructures of both organizations involved in a merger or acquisition. Your primary objective will be to understand compatibility, scalability, and potential integration challenges, ensuring that the cloud infrastructure is not only scalable but also secure and optimized for performance and cost efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including M&A, DevOps, security, and IT/Cloud operations, to ensure that all efforts align with business goals and technical requirements. You will be responsible for identifying risks associated with integrating different systems, technologies, and processes, and creating a comprehensive strategy to integrate the IT infrastructures while considering both immediate and long-term business objectives. Your expertise will be crucial in ensuring that IT systems and infrastructure are integrated seamlessly during the merger or acquisition process. Your responsibilities will span various domains of enterprise architecture, including business, data, application, and infrastructure practices. You will develop and maintain the organization's cloud strategy, ensuring it aligns with business objectives and technological advancements. Driving the adoption of cloud-native architectures and best practices, such as microservices, containers, and serverless computing, will be essential. You will also ensure that the integration supports the strategic goals of the merger or acquisition, maximizing value creation. Additionally, you will ensure that the cloud architecture adheres to industry standards and regulatory requirements, including data privacy and security. Implementing and maintaining security best practices in cloud environments, such as identity and access management (IAM), encryption, and network security, will be part of your responsibilities. You will collaborate with the security team to conduct regular security assessments and audits, drive automation efforts to reduce manual intervention, and improve operational efficiency. Staying up to date with the latest cloud technologies, trends, and industry best practices will be vital as you drive innovation by exploring new cloud services and tools that can enhance business processes and outcomes. Leading proof-of-concept initiatives and pilot projects to test new cloud solutions will also be part of your role, along with developing and maintaining comprehensive documentation of cloud architecture, processes, and standards.

Responsibilities
• Lead the strategic planning, design, and implementation of infrastructure solutions focusing on Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A).
,
• Analyze existing IT/cloud infrastructures to understand compatibility, scalability, and potential integration challenges.
,
• Ensure cloud infrastructure is scalable, secure, and optimized for performance and cost.
,
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including M&A, DevOps, security, and IT/Cloud operations, to align with business goals and technical requirements.
,
• Identify risks associated with integrating different systems, technologies, and processes.
,
• Create a strategy to integrate IT infrastructures considering immediate and long-term business goals.
,
• Develop and maintain the organization's cloud strategy, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technological advancements.
,
• Drive the adoption of cloud-native architectures and best practices, including microservices, containers, and serverless computing.
,
• Ensure integration supports the strategic goals of the merger or acquisition.
,
• Implement and maintain security best practices in cloud environments, such as IAM, encryption, and network security.
,
• Collaborate with the security team to conduct regular security assessments and audits.
,
• Drive automation efforts to reduce manual intervention and improve operational efficiency.
,
• Stay up to date with the latest cloud technologies, trends, and industry best practices.
,
• Drive innovation by exploring new cloud services and tools that can enhance business processes and outcomes.
,
• Lead proof-of-concept initiatives and pilot projects to test new cloud solutions.
,
• Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation of cloud architecture, processes, and standards.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (master's degree preferred).
,
• Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in IT, with at least 5 years in cloud architecture and design.
,
• Hands-on experience providing architectural guidance during the M&A process.
,
• Proven experience with major cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
,
• Strong background in infrastructure as code (IaC), DevOps practices, and CI/CD pipelines.
,
• Experience in leading large-scale cloud migration projects.

Nice-to-haves
• Relevant cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Google Professional Cloud Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect).
,
• Good understanding of federal regulations such as DFARS, NIST, GovCloud, and Fedramp; CMMC certification is an added advantage.

Benefits
qualifications: Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in IT, with at least 5 years in cloud architecture and design, Hands-on experience providing architectural guidance during the M&A process, Proven experience with major cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, Strong background in infrastructure as code (IaC), DevOps practices, and CI/CD pipelines, Experience in leading large-scale cloud migration projects, Relevant cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Google Professional Cloud Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect), Good understanding of federal regulations such as DFARS, NIST, GovCloud, and Fedramp; CMMC certification is an added advantage

title: Head of Cloud Architecture
description:
The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply Now button at the top or bottom of this page. After you click Apply Now and complete your application, you'll be invited to create a profile, which will let you see your application status and any communications. If you already have a profile with us, you can log in to check status.

Need Help?

If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to Accessibility (accommodation requests only; other inquiries won't receive a response).

Regular or Temporary:
Regular

Language Fluency: English (Required)

Work Shift:
1st shift (United States of America)

Please review the following job description:

The Head of Cloud Architecture will lead the bank's enterprise-wide cloud strategy, digital transformation efforts, and cloud security initiatives. This role requires a multifaceted expert with a proven track record in architecting, implementing, and securing large-scale cloud solutions within highly regulated environments.

The role requires technical expertise in both cloud architecture and security, business understanding, and leadership skills to drive our secure cloud-right approach. They will be responsible for maturing a comprehensive cloud adoption approach that aligns with business objectives, ensures regulatory compliance, leverages best-of-class technologies, and maintains high standards of security to protect our assets and customer data.

Key activities:
- Mature the architecture and oversee the implementation of a secure, scalable, and cost-effective multi-cloud ecosystem
- Design and oversee implementation of effective cloud security measures, including identity and access management, data protection, and threat detection
- Collaborate with C-level executives to align cloud and security initiatives with overall business strategy
- Drive innovation by identifying and integrating emerging cloud technologies and security solutions
- Manage teams of skilled cloud architects and security specialists, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
- Ensure compliance with stringent financial industry regulations and security standards in cloud environments
- Act as the key liaison between IT, security, business units, and cloud service providers
- Develop and implement comprehensive cloud security policies, procedures, and incident response plans
- Develop and maintain the bank's cloud architecture roadmap, strategy, and security framework
- Lead the design and implementation of secure, scalable, and compliant cloud solutions
- Oversee the development and execution of cloud security policies, standards, and best practices
- Collaborate with business units to identify opportunities for secure cloud adoption and migration
- Ensure compliance with financial industry regulations and security standards in cloud environments
- Manage relationships with cloud service providers and security vendors, negotiating contracts and service levels
- Mentor and lead teams of cloud architects, engineers, and security specialists
- Stay current with emerging cloud technologies, security threats, and industry trends
- Conduct regular security assessments, penetration testing, and vulnerability management for cloud infrastructure
- Lead incident response efforts for cloud-related security events
- Provide executive-level reporting on cloud architecture, security posture, and risk management

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Primary Roles & Responsibilities
1. Defines short term and long term architecture
2. Publishes best practices and educates ET population on it
3. Responsible for defining training, certification and career path for its members
4. Constantly analyses different technologies and vendors for new or better alternatives
5. Provides implementation and service support of "below the line" Core IT Platform infrastructure with a focus on Production Stability / Uptime
6. Provides continuous Capacity Planning to ensure service demands can be met
7. Manages EOL Evergreening of old equipment to manage technical debt
8. Enables "above the line" self-service abilities and provides support for Squads through automation
9. Provides continuous improvements of service capabilities through efficiencies & optimization - focus on fast, easy, simple at the right cost
10. Maintains Service level monitoring through dashboards
11. Consulting engagements for product squads to enable adaption and DevOps ownership practices: Example: Use of Terraform, or CI/CD onboarding

Driving Responsibilities
1. IT Infrastructure build-out and management:
2. Responsible for procurement, installation and life-cycle maintenance of IT hardware and software (includes PCs, peripherals, servers, networking equipment, operating systems and other software
3. Will seek out unmet business needs and propose technology-based solutions where appropriate. Will lead the selection and implementation of these solutions.
4. Will develop, gain approval for and manage a budget to accomplish goals.
5. Will serve on the Company IT Steering Team, which oversees all aspects of the company's information technology function.
6. Serves as the IT point of contact and accountable for the IT portion of new office setups, office expansions, etc. This includes relocation and/or installation of voice/data communications solutions, LAN and PC equipment.
7. Responsible for local IT vendor, contract and outsourcing management.
8. Responsible for monitoring data backups in offices to ensure that they are completed regularly.
9. Performs appropriate duties associated with project-based activities.
10. Responsible for the identification, development and communication of new technology standards and best practices as appropriate.
11. Support employee and business software functionality:
12. In cooperation with IT, local operations staff and key users, provide security, strategy, budgeting and disaster recovery/business continuity planning to offices and staff in multiple operating, business and functional units.
13. Serves as the technical and communications liaison to and from stakeholders and office key users for IT communications, initiatives, needs assessments, etc.
14. Provides new staff with PC/account setup and orientation.
15. Provides escalated technical support that requires an on-site presence (server, NAS, network or PC equipment failure), including data backup recovery. Performs complex software/hardware troubleshooting, patches and re-installations in cooperation with the Enterprise Helpdesk and accordance with established SLAs.
16. Provides consulting/training/education services such as data management and staff training/orientation for standard systems.
17. Administration, budget and policy management:
18. Responsible for local inventory maintenance and software license agreements management (SLA's).
19. Develops and monitors security compliance in accordance with IT standards, policies and procedures.
20. Responsible for maintenance of systems documentation such as IT operations manuals.
21. Special project leadership and / or support
22. Management of new vendor relationships for specific initiatives.
23. Willingness and ability to travel 10% to 15%

QUALIFICATIONS
Required Qualifications:
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
1. Bachelor's degree and ten to twenty-five years related experience or equivalent combination.
2. Managed Technology or Technology Process Teams for more than ten years or teams of thirty or more technologists.
3. Excellent knowledge of technical management and data governance.
4. Knowledge of current trends in IT hardware and systems software field.
5. Database management skills with the ability to produce reports.
6. Familiarity with the support and troubleshooting of personal computers and tablet devices.
7. Analyze situations, evaluate alternatives, and implement robust solutions
8. Interpret guidelines and analyze information to adapt or modify processes in response to changing circumstances.
9. Duties may require non-routine analysis, research and follow-through
10. The position requires strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to work independently and exercise sound judgment
11. The ability to make commitments and be willing to be held accountable against them, organizing workloads to meet deadlines
12. Exhibit adaptability to accept or bring about change when needed
13. Strong written and verbal communication skills
14. The ability to excel in a team environment and advance overall team objectives
15. The ability to ensure customer satisfaction by delivering excellence in products and service
16. Ability to work and communicate with peers, vendors, internal staff, including software program leadership and others
17. Consistently demonstrate professional, positive, and approachable attitude, demeanor and discretion
18. Demonstrate sensitivity in handling confidential information
19. Formulate and clearly communicate ideas to others
20. Fluency in English
21. Financial responsibility may include working within a budget to complete projects, negotiating and contracting with vendors and assisting with budget development
22. Purchase equipment and supplies as provided for in the budget
23. Ability to manage personnel with little supervision

Preferred Qualifications:

- Baster's degree
- 12+ years of experience in IT architecture and security, with at least 7 years focused on cloud technologies
- Expertise in major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and their security features
- Strong understanding of financial industry regulations and compliance requirements related to cloud and data security

Join our team of data enthusiasts and be a part of shaping our data-driven future.💡 What You'll Do:Analyze large datasets to extract valuable insights and trends.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address complex business questions.Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.Utilize statistical analysis to generate actionable recommendations.Stay up-to-date with the latest data analytics tools and techniques.Promote data-driven decision-making throughout the organization.

title: Data Reporting Analyst
description:
Job Summary

Provides customer analytics and performance reporting that drive business priorities for internal parners in Marketing and Brand Experience, Consumer, Community and Wholesale Banking lines of business. Designs and maintains customer and segment scorecards, dashboards and reports that offer visibility into our customer base. Develops and delivers customer behavioral analyses that answer critical business questions, validate assumptions and debunk myths. Works with customer household, account and transaction data to support, execute, and measure business strategies to drive revenue, improve customer experience, and reduce costs. Partners effectively with internal technology resources and third-party data and/or research providers.

Job Duties and Responsibilities
• Performs data mining and customer analysis. Researches, compiles, and performs complex analysis on critical customer, account, transactional, and or behavioral data
• Researches, compiles, and performs complex analysis on critical customer, account, and transactional data using tools such as SQL Assistant, Databricks, Power BI, etc.
• Remains current on best practices of business analytics trends, techniques and tools. May identify emerging trends in technology and analysis as opportunities for future business growth and development.
• Manages multiple assignments simultaneously and completes assignments within established time frames. Keeps all facts straight and communicates key points succinctly.
• Maintains necessary processes, controls and procedures to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Leverages multiple internal or external information sources and ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies.
• Creates engaging and informative presentations that communicate results to management and executive audiences.
• Presents complex material to all levels of management in a digestible, consumable manner.
• Builds effective business partnerships with all levels of team members.
• Serves as a liaison between business units, technology teams, finance teams and other support teams.
• May work closely with the analytics' data science team to identify location, structure, and function of data related to modeling projects. Tracks down programs, data sources and crafting queries to power programs.
• May be responsible for designing and developing data visualization solutions according to business requirements to effectively communicate insights and provide performance measurement solutions to business decision makers.
• May train, coach or direct the work of lower level analysts.
• Each team member is expected to be aware of risk within their functional area. This includes observing all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and risk limits specific to their role. Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.
• May perform regression, risk and driver analyses to answer business questions and works with data scientists to drive the strategic development of more complex audience sampling and predictive models in support of the business.
• May work with business partners to define issues and information needs and translates them into specific data/technical requirements to support business initiatives and projects.
• May work with business partners to define issues and information needs and translates them into a qualitative or quantiative survey that will help provide the infomation needed.
• May work with business partners to define and map customer experience issues and translates them into current and future state journey maps to support the prioritization of process, product or people enhancements.
• May use analytical tools such as SQL Assistant, SAS, R, Python, Tableau, etc.
• Performs other related duties as required.

The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Synovus is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplace

Minimum Education:
• Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline and/or business or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Years of Experience:
• 4-5 years

Minimum experience:
• Four or more years of hands-on data wrangling, reporting, analytics, data programming, or technical experience in consumer data and marketing database technology

Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
• Knowledge of the industry's standard business practices, products, and services
• Comfortable working with fluid priorities and tight deadlines
• Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
• Ability to interact and influence successfully at all levels of the organization
• Demonstrated experience leading and coaching teams
• Exceptional verbal, written and presentation communication skills
• Highly proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint
• Demonstrated data management skills utilizing a large and complex database environment OR using statistical software to collect data and assimilate statistics
• Exceptional technical skills using tools such as SQL Assistant, SAS, R, Python, Tableau, SPSS, Access

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
• Job related experience in the financial services industry
• Working knowledge of regression, driver analysis, and more complex data modeling principles
• Experience with cloud base marketing campaign management systems, performance analytics and attribution analysis

title: Healthcare Financial Data Analyst
description:
Healthcare Financial Data Analysts - McDonough, GA
• You will be creating reports and dashboards, and then looking at data and telling the story
• Along with teammates, you will be presenting the story to the CFO
• Needs someone who is accurate and informative
• The person needs to be able to work across departments and we are also looking at implementing power business intelligence.
• Monday - Friday schedule
• Hybrid schedule available once probationary period is past

Duties include:
• Our Healthcare Data Analysts play a critical role in shaping clinical and business decisions by managing and interpreting healthcare data.
• Their responsibilities include collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to uncover valuable insights that support decision-making.
• They are tasked with data mining, preparation, and presentation of information for both internal and external stakeholders, ensuring data-driven strategies and solutions are effectively implemented.
• We require experience as a financial data analyst in the healthcare setting.

We are a top outpatient healthcare group in metro Atlanta.

We are growing throughout the area, including onboarding 10 new APPs and physicians in 2025.

Why join us?
• 401k available after one year, 100% company match on the first 3% and 50% match on the next 2% (if you contribute 5%, company will match at 4%)
• 19 PTO days per year, with an additional 4 hours of PTO for weekend on-call
• 7 paid holidays per year (New Years, Memorial Date, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Day after Thanksgiving, Christmas)
• Amazing CFO who is intelligent, empathetic and leads through building a positive culture fixating on being the best we can be.

title: Data Analyst
description:
We seek a Data Analyst to join our team in Marietta, GA. In this role, you will clean, extract, analyze, and explore large complex datasets to gain meaningful insights to inform and drive decision-making. You will identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns and generate actionable insights. This role will build the analysis process and foundational reporting. Collaborating across the company, you will define and support data needs and present insights in clear and compelling ways with visualizations, reports, and presentations. You will create dashboards that give real-time insights to our executive team and various departments, i.e. sales, inventory, and finance. You will also develop our data management policies and procedures.

This is a great opportunity to come in, own your role, and expand it for the future.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Develop and/or implement data collection systems and strategies that optimize quality and efficiency and maintain integrity and consistency
• Create and automate reports to improve efficiency in reporting processes; set up and maintain reporting cadence
• Define the data collection processes and develop analysis workflows
• Evaluate data analytics tools and technologies and make recommendations
• Keep current on new applications, technologies, technical methods, trends, and advances in the data analytics and visualization field
• Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science; or equivalent work experience
• 5+ years' experience in Data Analytics; experience with data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and forecasting
• Proven ability to use statistical methods to test hypotheses, identify trends, and make predictions
• Work experience with Python, SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems
• Proficiency in data visualization tools i.e. Tableau, Power BI
• Proficiency in statistical analysis and predictive modeling
• Proven experience in communicating complex results in an understandable way to non-technical stakeholders
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Critical thinking skills to identify strengths and weaknesses of solutions

Preferred Qualifications:
• Microsoft Certified Data Analyst Associate
• Proven experience building a data analytics program from the ground up

This position works on-site daily in Marietta, GA, Monday through Thursday, 8 AM to 5 PM, and Friday, 8 AM to 4:30 PM. The position may require occasional travel to attend training workshops and conferences.

Benefits:
• Weekly Pay
• Comprehensive Health Benefits
• Employee Assistance Program
• 401(k) matching
• Paid Time Off (PTO)
• Paid Holidays

We are not working with outside agencies at this time.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Position Title: Data Analytics Coordinator

Location: Atlanta GA - Onsite

Position Status: Full time

Pay Rate: $50K

Position Description:
• Leverages the use of data analytics tools (e.g. QlikSense, Databricks, Snowflake, Python, Alteryx, etc.) to implement solutions, and to increase team’s efficiency and reliability.
• Manage and oversees cross-functional data analytics projects across departments, guiding them from inception through production while ensuring adherence to quality standards and deadlines.
• Collaborate in defining metrics to expand depth of analysis, to improve internal processes and uncover quantifiable business opportunities.
• Design, develop and maintain scalable data products for data warehousing (Data Lake concept).
• Cultivate trust and cooperation with stakeholders, fostering a collaborative environment that promotes knowledge sharing.
• Clearly convey findings and insights to upper management and internal stakeholders to support strategic decision-making.
• Provide guidance and training to peers or stakeholders on data analytics tools and best practices.
• Continuously update knowledge on the latest data analytics technologies and trends to ensure the application of cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in information systems, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI) to create impactful, easy-to-understand visual reports.
• Proficient in ETL processes using tools like Databricks, Snowflake, Alteryx, or similar platforms.
• Preferred experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, among others.
• Proven ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional environment with minimal supervision.
• Strong capability to analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and establish processes for regular updates and reporting.
• Ability to adapt to changing tasks and priorities, based on business needs.
• Able to approach unfamiliar issues logically and systematically, gathering and synthesizing relevant information from multiple sources.
• Capable of delivering clear explanations, particularly for non-routine or technical matters.

About Seneca Resources:

Seneca Resources is a client driven provider of strategic Information Technology consulting services and Workforce Solutions to government and industry. Seneca Resources is a leading IT services provider with offices in Virginia, Alabama, Georgia, Florida and Texas that service clients throughout the United States.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workplace.

Please review the following job description:

JOB SUMMARY

Produces reports or package of reports utilizing databases, data assets, applications and more to provide information to business leaders. Reports may be in the form of standardized dashboards or customized views of data upon request. Ensures data pulled is consistent with business needs/requests. Applies knowledge of the business to customize reports and deliver meaningful information. Reviews reports to identify data integrity issues and provides feedback to application/database administrators to ensure any issues are addressed. Answers questions from end-users of reports to provide additional context. Reporting may be focused on regulatory matters, operational metrics, and productivity metrics Produces reports utilizing databases and applications to provide information to business leaders. Reports may be in the form of standardized dashboards or customized views of data upon request. Ensures data pulled is consistent with business needs/requests. Applies knowledge of the business to customize reports and deliver meaningful information. Applies a comprehensive understanding of end-to-end data processes/flows and concepts to implement frameworks, processes, controls, models, and solutions to ensure data is effectively managed across the organization or within a specific business unit. Reviews reports to identify data integrity issues and provides feedback to application/database administrators to ensure any issues are addressed. Answers questions from end-users of reports to provide additional context. Reporting may be focused on regulatory matters, operational metrics, and productivity metrics. Responsible for maintaining the integrity of data during the transfer from source systems into business unit data assets Applies a comprehensive understanding of data processes/flows and concepts to implement frameworks, processes, controls, models, and solutions for business unit. Be able to set the standards / apply data for fit for use when applying data into business decisions. Drives out the identification and mitigation of data issues as necessary to support organization priorities. Identifies and champions the implementation of data process and practice improvements. Lead automation for all deliverables with process efficiency and effectiveness.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
• Lead business analysis efforts for projects related to finance and regulatory reporting. Using SAS , SQL etc. , conduct exploratory data analysis, data profiling, investigate data errors, generate ad-hoc reports, validate data as part of user acceptance testing.
• Partner with technology and architecture team for system functionality enhancements , research, analyze, design, and/or maintain data sources in information systems in support of projects, information needs, and changing requirements
• Apply deep understanding of data integration process and participate in large/complex data warehouse initiatives, design discussions, and prototype review.
• Perform analysis, validation and interpretation of reporting outputs.
• Responsible for identifying Critical data elements, developing business rules, reconciliation checks, measuring data quality. Identify the data quality issues and data gaps in the current organization environment, analyze the root cause for data issues and provide data quality improvement solutions.
• Work with Regulatory reporting team and help translate reporting instructions into functional business requirements.
• Uses sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions.
• Applies a comprehensive understanding of how the organization operates to solve technical, operational, and business problems.

QUALIFICATIONS

• Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

• Sound and comprehensive understanding of business and organizational strategies and processes.
• Ability to interpret internal and external business challenges and implement best practices to improve products, processes, or services.
• Ability to lead projects of significant complexity and risk exposure.
• Ability to exercise judgment in solving technical, operational, and organizational challenges in the context of business objectives and priorities.
• Sophisticated analytical skills and the ability to solve complex technical and business problems.
• Ability to influence others to adopt a new perspective (new automation, new metrics, new tools etc.) Focus on process automation to improve efficiency.
• Knowledge of the industry's competitive landscape and an understanding of the market and regulatory factors that shape the industry.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master's degree or MBA and 10 years of related experience.
• Previous experience in the banking industry.
• Proficiency with SAS and SQL.
• Experience with Data Integration, Extraction, Transformation, and Loading
• Understanding of Data Management/Governance principles.
• BI reporting experience.

title: Sr. Data Analyst - Nursing - Cardiovascular Services
description:
Job Description

Grady Health System offers many career paths for experienced professionals. Whether you have many years of experience or are in the early stages of your career, you can find a rewarding career at Grady!

SUMMARY

The Data Analyst Sr. - Nursing is accountable for assisting leadership with performance monitoring and improvement across multiple departments and services. This position utilizes project management and data analytical skills to assist with planning, executing and finalizing projects within established deadlines.

Work with internal departments to enhance the use of data to improve management of our core businesses.

I. Project Coordination / Process Improvement (25%):
• Continuously assists data analyst with departmental implementation of process changes and improvements.

II. Data Management and Analytics (20%):
• Develop and manage comprehensive analyses for internal and external audiences that support the plan to achieve nursing related goals.
• Identify and communicate impact of analytical findings and leverage business intelligence tools to develop, analyze and defend analytic results.
• Provide point of coordination for nursing leaders to integrate and leverage analytics outcomes.

III. Leadership / Training (25%):
• Provides training, testing and auditing as well as work on special projects pertaining to data integrity improvement initiatives. Provides day-to-day directions of work for data analysts.
• Provide leadership and mentor team with use of business knowledge and analytics expertise. Sets priorities for the team and ensures tasks completion.
• Participates in employee counseling, hiring, termination and performance evaluations.

IV. Administrative Support (10%):
• Oversee various operational/administrative tasks that support Nursing Business Operations, including but not limited to position management, workforce optimization, capital and operating budgets, contract labor management, and cost center performance reporting.
• Oversee maintenance of departmental employee files and new employee needs in collaboration with Unit Educators, Clinical Managers and Directors, including but not limited to; preparing employee departmental and educational files, ensuring required certifications (BLS, ACLS, etc) are up-to-date, and coordinating 30/90 day new employee meetings.
• Ensures continuous readiness for regulatory visits and participates in the process as indicated.

V. Finance Budget
• Assists in performing ongoing financial analysis and monitors metrics to understand changes to the business. Collaborates with the Executive Director to develop annual capital and operating budgets for nursing.
• Assists the Executive Director with providing ad hoc financial analysis to facilitate operational decision making.

Education

Required:
• Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Business, Finance, or related field or any equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience

Required:
• With Bachelor's Degree: Four (4) or more years job related experience including data management, finance, or project management.
• With two (2) years college or Associate's Degree: six (6) or more years job related experience including data management, finance, or project management.

Equal Opportunity Employer-Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Crisis & Resilience
description:
We are hiring a Senior Data Analyst, Crisis & Resilience as a part of our Enterprise Resilience and Crisis Management (ERCM) Team. In an era marked by unprecedented global challenges, the significance of resilience and crisis management cannot be overstated. The world's interconnectedness has amplified the impacts of crises, be they economic downturns, natural disasters, pandemics, or socio-political upheavals. Resilience empowers organizations to adapt, recover, and flourish despite these adversities. It fosters a proactive mindset, where anticipation, preparation, and swift response to crises are paramount. Furthermore, effective crisis management ensures that when disruptions occur, there are structured strategies in place to mitigate damage, facilitate recovery, and sustain operations. Together, resilience and crisis management form the backbone of a robust response framework, enhancing our ability to navigate and thrive in an increasingly complex and dynamic global landscape.

The Enterprise Resilience and Crisis Management (ERCM) Team is hiring a Senior Data Analyst who’ll have the opportunity to own and architect the end-to-end data lifecycle for crisis and resilience analytics. Day to day you will work closely with our business stakeholders to learn about their business and understand their data and analytics challenges. Additionally, you will work with our current Analytics team to help manage our Azure Resources and work with other engineering teams to source and ingest data, model, and prepare data for analysis and usage. Finally, you’ll work with ERCM team members to deliver insights on risks to help drive crisis and resilience stakeholders across the enterprise.

The Senior Data Analyst, Crisis & Resilience will be skilled at leveraging data as a strategic asset and can map analyses to areas of risk for action; has a record of accomplishment in developing data analyses that address risks or performance, collaborating and influencing across teams to develop key performance indicators, coordinating multiple timelines, and managing complex, cross discipline projects. The Senior Data Analyst, Crisis & Resilience should be agile and able to adapt to support an ever-changing company, evolving technology stack, and shifting risk environment; leads by example and fosters an open work environment where cross-collaboration, inclusiveness, and diversity of perspective are valued.

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  

#CELA

Responsibilities
• Build scalable data assets (dashboards, underlying data sets, and workflows) to unlock reliable and high velocity decision support
• Contribute to and manage the Azure infrastructure (e.g., Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure SQL, Azure Synapse, Kusto/Azure Data Explorer, Power BI, Azure Log Analytics, Data Flows, Fabric)
• Perform analyses using a variety of analytical tools (SQL, Python, Azure Databricks, Synapse, Power BI, Fabric etc), execute analyses and interpret results with actionable recommendations, and partners to build on others’ frameworks.
• Problem solve with crisis and resilience SMEs and do deep dive data analyses on their data flows, requirements and ideate data solutions
• Continually ensure both security and privacy are paramount in the ways that Enterprise Resilience and Crisis Management (ERCM) stewards the data that it has access to.

Other
• Embody our culture and values

Qualifications

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 4+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
• OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 2+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
• OR equivalent experience.
• 4+ years experience working in a data intensive environment and translating business needs into data requirements
• 2+ years experience Microsoft Azure stack, SQL, Python, Azure Databricks, Synapse, Power BI, Fabric, and/or Machine Learning and AI

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 6+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
• OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 4+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
• OR equivalent experience.
• 6+ years of demonstrated experience working in a data intensive environment and translating business needs into data requirements (experience with Microsoft Azure stack, SQL, Python, Azure Databricks, Synapse, Power BI, Fabric, Machine Learning and AI).
• 3+ years crisis management and resilience experience working in a large multinational organization.
• 3+ years experience collaborating effectively with PMs, non-technical team members, and other technical SMEs as well as across teams to define and implement sustainable solutions.
• 3+ years experience leading cross-functional and/or cross-team projects.

Data Analytics IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $103,800 - $200,300 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $133,700 - $219,200 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

Microsoft will accept applications for the role until February 5, 2025

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer - Transplantation
description:
Experience the Pride of a Quality-Driven Career

Join the Quality team at NewYork-Presbyterian and bring new meaning to your career! Channel your top-notch passion about data accuracy and play an active role in world-class care and caring. Thrive as a valued member of the team as a critical member of the team for data management and analysis at NewYork-Presbyterian and feel the pride of quality-driven achievement. Learn how you can help Make It Possible.

Senior Business Intelligence Developer – Transplantation

The Senior Business Intelligence Developer will play a pivotal role in the design, development, and deployment of clinical analytics and Business Intelligence applications. As a key member of the Analytics and Insights Project Team, this position will act as a bridge between application teams and clinical departments.

Utilizing both clinical and operational expertise along with a strong foundation in information systems, the Senior Developer will identify innovative ways to harness data analytics to enhance quality and drive efficiency. This role will involve close collaboration with clinical teams to define, develop, and analyze key performance metrics.

In addition, the Senior Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining Business Intelligence applications, including operational reports, dashboards, scorecards, and ad hoc reporting requests. The position also provides support and mentorship to other Business Intelligence Developers and ensures the creation of clear, comprehensive technical documentation.

This position is based out of our corporate office in Midtown Manhattan with possible travel to any of our NYP sites and will be full-time Monday to Friday. Hybrid Schedule includes 4 days in office and 1 day remote.

Preferred Criteria
• 7+ years of experience in developing business intelligence applications
• Proficient in SQL and other database technologies
• Extensive knowledge of data visualization techniques and dashboard design (e.g., Tableau)
• Strong experience with ETL processes and data warehousing principles
• Expertise in building predictive models using R and SAS

Required Criteria
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent work experience
• 5-7 years of relevant professional experience

Join a healthcare system where employee engagement is at an all-time high. Here we foster a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Enjoy comprehensive and competitive benefits that support you and your family in every aspect of life. Start your life-changing journey today.

Please note that all roles require on-site presence (variable by role). Therefore, all employees should live within a commutable distance to NYP.

NYP will not reimburse for travel expenses.

__________________
• 2024 “Great Place To Work Certified”
• 2024 “America’s Best Large Employers” – Forbes
• 2024 “Best Places to Work in IT” – Computerworld
• 2023 “Best Employers for Women” – Forbes
• 2023 “Workplace Well-being Platinum Winner” – Aetna
• 2023 “America’s Best-In-State Employers” – Forbes
• “Silver HCM Excellence Award for Learning & Development” – Brandon Hall Group

NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital is an equal opportunity employer.

Salary Range:

$131,500-$163,000/Annual

It all begins with you. Our amazing compensation packages start with competitive base pay and include recognition for your experience, education, and licensure. Then we add our amazing benefits, countless opportunities for personal and professional growth and a dynamic environment that embraces every person. Join our team and discover where amazing works.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Job Description:

When you join MSC Technology, you’ll be part of a leading-edge team that values expert insights, bold ideas, and intellectual courage. Through constant learning, discovery, and collaboration you’ll not only help our global users deliver on the promise of digital, you’ll grow your career and the scope of your impact across our company. Our culture demands hard work — and rewards it with exceptional opportunity. If you’re always looking for what’s next in technology, MSC Technology is looking for you.

About this role:

BI Developer works together with BI Support to address questions, solve problems and work on small enhancements for any analytics solution. The Business Intelligence Developer will develop and maintain tabular cubes to support fact-based decision-making. You’ll join a team of 12 developers where we strive to share knowledge and help each other to achieve more.

What you’ll do:

· Designs, documents, administers, and maintains AAS cubes (Tabular using DAX but experience with Azure Data Warehouse/Fabric is a plus)

· Analyze existing complex systems to understand and document data elements, relationships, data flow, dependencies, and their related interfaces

· Perform Unit testing and resolve defects

· Responsible for designing, developing, and supporting back end solutions for intuitive reports, dashboards using Microsoft Fabric capabilities.

· Data model design with calculated columns, measures, calculated tables

· Mentor and support other Developers and business partners

· Create and maintain detailed documentation for team

· Perform training and knowledge transfer of technology

· Provides ongoing performance monitoring and tuning, and automation of production activities related the BI environment

· Investigate questions on data integrity and quality

Job Requirements:

What you’ll need:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering / Computer Science / Information Technology

Min 2 years business experience of design, development, maintenance, and performance tuning on Azure Analysis Services

Expert SQL and T-SQL Programming skills

Experience with dimensional data modeling

Experience with Microsoft Azure DB, Azure DW or Fabric is a big plus

Experience with creation of data warehouses is a big plus

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Strong problem-solving skills

Strong knowledge of emerging technologies and tools

Strong organizational and time management skills

Effective collaboration of tasks across the business and technical teams

Who you are:

Ability to work independently, contribute to the greater team and to handle multiple projects/tasks concurrently

Excellent project management, communication, attention to detail, problem solving, and initiative skills required

Learning agility: can work productively in uncertain and fast changing environments. Finds opportunities in ambiguity; embraces and adapts to change; adept at learning by doing

Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis, determine the root cause of problems, and create alternative solutions to solve them in the best interest of the business

• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Employee discount
• Flexible spending account
• Health insurance
• Health savings account
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Parental leave
• Vision insurance

• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

• Microsoft SQl Server Analysis Services: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:
• Township of Warren, NJ 07059 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Power BI Developer (Day 1 Onsite)
description:
Greetings from IT Engagements…!

IT Engagements is a global staff augmentation firm providing a wide-range of talent on-demand and total workforce solutions. We have an immediate opening for the below position with one of our premium clients.

Job Title: Power BI Developer

Onsite in NYC-Needed local NJ - Required Usc/GC

Financial Domain

Job Summary: We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Power BI Developer/Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying Power BI reports, dashboards, and data models. This role involves working closely with business stakeholders to understand data needs, create meaningful visualizations, and enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Key Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, and interactive visualizations.
• Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into actionable data models and reports.
• Extract, clean, and transform data from various sources using Power Query and Power BI Desktop.
• Develop and optimize data models to improve performance and usability..
• Work with Power BI Service for publishing, sharing, and managing reports and dashboards.
• Ensure data integrity and consistency in reports, and troubleshoot issues when they arise.
• Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing reports, dashboards, and Power BI solutions.
• Stay current with Power BI features, best practices, and industry trends.

Skills And Qualifications
• Strong proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI Service.
• Experience in connecting to and integrating data from various sources such as SQL Server, Excel, SharePoint, and other databases.
• Experience with ETL processes, data cleaning, and data transformation techniques.
• Knowledge of data warehousing and business intelligence concepts.
• Financial experience is required

Qualifications
• Experience with Power BI administration (setting up workspaces, user access management).
• Knowledge of additional BI tools or technologies (e.g., Tableau, QlikView) is a plus.

Regards,

Shashank Jaitly

Shashank@itengagements.com
