title: Service Manager
description:
At Tesla, our Service Managers are the front-line leaders of our service operation. They act as brand ambassadors, delivering an exceptional experience to customers, managing day-to-day operations, and proactively developing team members to reach their full potential. We hire leaders who want to run a service business and be a part of our mission to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy.
Our Service Managers consistently deliver excellent results across all aspects of the business: customer satisfaction, people leadership, operations, and financials. To succeed at Tesla, you must be energetic, highly organized, smart working, and have a passion for true leadership and our brand.

Responsibilities
• Exceed customer expectations, monitor service trends, and develop standards and processes to elevate the overall service experience
• Lead by example, prioritize team success, and actively engage in team growth and development, providing regular feedback and mentoring
• Understand and improve all aspects of service center performance, championing safety, efficiency, quality, and technical acumen in service operations
• Grasp business metrics, lead daily operations to achieve specific goals in productivity, quality, cost, and revenue/margin where applicable
• Embrace change, excel in high-pressure situations, exhibit strong prioritization and time management skills, and combine analytical thinking with hands-on problem-solving and a customer-service mindset
• Act in the best interest of Tesla, advocate for customers and team success, and demonstrate a passion for Tesla's mission, people, and customers

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
• Prior leadership experience in a service-focused industry; automotive expertise is not required
• Experience leading teams and managing a diverse group of roles and responsibilities
• Strong and proven experience leading field, technical repair, or manufacturing teams in a fast-paced, technology-driven environment with strong customer facing responsibilities
• Experience running complex processes using Lean or other techniques
• Valid driver's license required

Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
• Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
• Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
• Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
• Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
• Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
• 401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
• Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
• Employee Assistance Program
• Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
• Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
• Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
• Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
• Tesla Babies program
• Commuter benefits
• Employee discounts and perks program
Expected Compensation

$104,000 - $180,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

title: Software Asset Manager
description:
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Software Asset Manager to work in Fidelity’s Enterprise Technology Group in Westlake, TX. Team
As part of Enterprise Infrastructure & Operations Foundational Tools Team, you will partner across Fidelity technology organizations to implement and support industry leading software asset management practices. You will also play a key role in driving the automation and modernization of Fidelity’s SAM practices to support the next generation IT Operations, SRE and DevOps! The Role
The Software Asset Manager role supports the day-to-day activities associated with the organization’s IT assets, ensuring operational efficiencies and data completeness through the full lifecycle of IT assets across a hybrid environment (multi-cloud and on-prem), including:
• Handling key relationships with peer roles across the enterprise, including: Business Application Owners, Service Catalogue Manager, Software Product Owners, and Procurement representatives.
• Accountable to ensure new entitlement purchases, true-ups, and maintenance renewals, including maintenance of contract pricing and negotiated terms.
• Collaborate to ensure licensing contracts are optimized based on usage and predicted consumption.
• Understand impact of maintenance / assurance, support contracts and requirements.
• Leading analysis, design, and requirements for IT SAM process improvements and feature enhancements
• Handle lifecycle stages of software assets from initial request - purchasing, deployment, maintenance - through removal from service.
• Ensuring quality of software asset records within the Asset Management Repository, including Software Discovery Models, Software Product Models and Software Entitlements.
• Discover and establish a full inventory of software deployed.
• Identify and correlate hardware and devices of the deployed software.
• Identify number of licenses, licensing scheme / type, and utilization of each discovered software.
• Identify publishers for whom we do not have full license spend and see high-level where we are non-compliance.
• Identify licensed applications, and identify vendor, count, cost per license, and current license holders. Categorize all license usage: assigned in-use, assigned unused, unassigned, expired.
• Develop and analyze reconciliation reports to resolve required actions to address non-compliant software installations.
• Performing reconciliation by comparing entitlements with discovered software installations to resolve effective license positions for each in-scope publisher.
The Expertise and Skills we’re Looking For
• Self-motivated teammate who brings energy, enthusiasm, and intellectual curiosity to the role
• Outstanding execution skills and attention to detail
• Strong quantitative and qualitative problem-solving skills
• Effective in finding opportunities for improvement, prioritizing options, and recommendations
• Experience leading day-to-day operational activities for a Software Asset Management (SAM) program
• Experience managing IT assets throughout their full lifecycle
• Solid understanding of software licensing models, including for large vendors (IBM, Oracle, Microsoft, etc.)
• Experience with asset discovery tools and managing associated data; to analyze and identify potential gaps
• Significant experience with SAM related platforms, tools, and integrations - including ServiceNow SAM and Ariba
• Experience as a member of vendor audit activities, including leading software publisher audits to closure
• Undergraduate degree, or equivalent experience
Dynamic Working
Fidelity’s hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Working onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of every other week in a Fidelity office.Company Overview

Fidelity TalentSource is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s supportive and collaborative culture while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. Apply today at FTSJobs.com.
We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
Fidelity TalentSource will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, please contact our HR team at HR@ ftsjobs.com.
Information about Fidelity Investments

At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding: to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.

Fidelity’s hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Having the majority of our associates work onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most roles listed as Hybrid will require associates to work onsite all business days of every other week in a Fidelity office. This does not apply to roles listed as Remote or Onsite.

Fidelity Investments and Fidelity TalentSource are equal opportunity employers.

title: IT Asset Management Specialist
description:
Investigate, locate, and retrieve lost or unreturned assets using available systems. Communicate with customers on the status of IT Inventory request tickets. Resolve work orders or assign to Warehouse staff for processing. Maintain asset records in Service Now Asset Management Module.

Create or maintain reports to support these functions.

Experience in Service Now or similar ticketing or asset management system.

Ability to follow prescribed inventory control standards.

Skill in using a computer and Microsoft Office Suite software with specific focus in Excel

title: Information Technology (IT) Specialist/Asset Manager
description:
Cortina Solutions is seeking an Information Technology (IT) Specialist/Asset Manager to support a government customer in Albuquerque, NM.

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Job Duties:
• Account for and understand the various Air Force and Space Force IT assets policies, procedures, supply chain-based and directives for asset accountability
• Follow procedures for asset management and logistical activities such as equipment ordering, receiving, safeguarding, transfer, and disposal
• Maintain asset control and inventory records in electronic format or database and ensure completion of annual inventory
• Ensure all government assets are correctly identified and properly labeled in accordance with installation and USSF/USAF policy
• Build, maintain and update hard/soft copies of equipment identification and location nin the custodian's folders
• Identify, report and provide report of survey and inventory adjustment record of any assets lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed
• Maintain, track and submit required initial and renewal licenses of acquired software with government lead to ensure coverage of usage
• Manage maintenance repair and warranty exchanges

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Information Technology or related field
• Minimum of ten (10) years' experience with DoD
• Understanding of FAR, DFARS, and other government property management regulations
• Proficiency in property management software systems
• Experience in tracking, tagging and maintaining accountability for government-furnished property
• Ability to conduct audits and prepare detailed reports in compliance with government regulations
• High level of accuracy in maintaining records, including receipts, transfers and disposals of property
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Active Top Secret Security clearance

Covid Vaccination Policy:Cortina does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

Cortina Solutions, LLC is committed to hiring and maintaining a diversified workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

Asour team members work on government sites, all potential candidates are subject to a background screening that fully complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

title: ServiceNow IT Asset Management Technical Product Owner
description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand - with heart at its center - our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.Position Summary

We are seeking a ServiceNow Technical Product Owner with a strong background in IT Asset Management (ITAM) and a passion for product ownership. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in ITAM product offerings and a solid foundation in Agile/SAFe product management, coupled with a demonstrated commitment to the ITAM discipline. Must be a excellent communicator with ability to document and present to different levels of organization including technical, management, and business operations.Key Responsibilities:
• Liaison Role: Act as a liaison to Product Owners/Managers across the ServiceNow Platform, understanding the technical and business implications of planned work for ITAM.
• Demand Board Participation: Actively participate in the ServiceNow Platform Demand Board, providing specific product expertise and broader technical insights.
• Governance Liaison: Serve as the primary contact for the team with ServiceNow Platform Governance bodies.
• Roadmap Planning: Represent the technical perspective in ITAM roadmap planning, understanding the implications of value streams, ITAM strategy, and overall roadmap.
• Prioritization Representation: Communicate the Product Manager's and Business Owner's roadmap priorities to the Agile team.
• Deliverable Translation: Translate roadmap priorities into technical, process, and Organizational Change Management (OCM) deliverables.
• Epic Creation: Develop Epics based on the roadmap.
• PI Planning Coordination: Coordinate topics for Program Increment (PI) Planning and facilitate the planning sessions, representing team plans and accomplishments to stakeholders.
• Sprint Planning Participation: Actively engage in sprint planning sessions.
• Feature Assessment: Assess and accept the delivery of features.
• Progress Reporting: Represent team progress in weekly status meetings, providing insights to the Product Manager or coaching them as needed.
• Upgrade Review Management: Ensure process owners, architects, and other stakeholders review upgrade release notes and gather recommendations for roadmap discussions.
• Work Management: Informally manage team workload and dynamics without direct personnel management responsibilities.
• Agile Coaching: Coach the team in Agile roles, providing direction and oversight as necessary, including:
• Monitoring Scrum Master compliance with detailed processes for solution migration.
• Overseeing Business Analyst feature creation.
• Protecting team capacity from over commitment by management.
• Consulting Resource Oversight: Oversee consulting resources performing Agile functions, including Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, Technical Writers, and Technical Analysts. Note that FTE architects will provide leadership for the technical team, while process owners will oversee process consultants and OCM consultants.
Required Qualifications
• 7+ years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst or similar role, with a focus on ServiceNow.
• Strong knowledge of ServiceNow administration, testing management, and platform engineering.
• Experience with IT Asset Management (ITAM), Configuration Management Database (CMDB), and other ServiceNow capabilities ( HAM Pro, SAM Pro, Discovery).
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Strong understanding of Agile Framework, Scaled Agile, but comfortable operating in a context that is not purely Agile
• Ability to manage upward and deliver negative news to authority
• Strong commitment to the Agile process or replanning as business needs require (on sprint boundaries)
• Self-managed, self-directed, self-motivated
• Servant leader to the team and strategic thinker
Preferred Qualifications
• Able to speak to the current state of the ITAM solution (available capabilities, planned capabilities)
• SAFe certification
• PSM certification
• AgilePM Foundation certification
• ICAgile Certified Professional (ICP)
• Project Management Institute - Agile Certified Professional (PMI-ACP)
• ITIL V4 Foundation Certification
• ServiceNow Certified System Administrator
Education
Bachelor degree from accredited university or equivalent work experience (HS diploma + 4 years relevant experience)BUSINESS OVERVIEW
Bring your heart to CVS Health Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand - with heart at its center - our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver. Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable. We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an affirmative action employer, and is an equal opportunity employer, as are the physician-owned businesses for which CVS Health provides management services. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, promotion, or any other personnel action based on race, ethnicity, color, national origin, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. The typical pay range for this role is:$106,605.00 - $284,280.00

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above. This position also includes an award target in the company's equity award program.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company's 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

title: Comptroller - IT Asset and Contract Management Analyst (Reopen)
description:
If you have previously applied, there is no need to reapply. You application is still being considered for this position.

Applications must be filed at: https://capps.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobdetail.ftl?job=00047122

Please note that this job posting can be closed without notice and earlier than the closing date indicated in the posting if a suitable candidate is found. We encourage applicants to submit and complete the application promptly.

Are you ready to grow, make a positive impact? If you are seeking to gain knowledge, build your career, and network among goal-oriented professionals, this is the place for you!

Innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence best describes the culture here at the Comptroller’s Office. We take pride in the work we do serving as Texas' accountant, tax collector, treasurer, and much more! The Comptroller’s office serves virtually every citizen in the state. As Texas’ chief tax collector, accountant, revenue estimator, treasurer and purchasing manager, the agency is responsible for writing the checks and keeping the books for the multi-billion-dollar business of state government.

Our agency workforce is as diverse as the people of Texas we serve. We value our employees and take very seriously our collective commitment to public service. Personal development opportunities are strongly encouraged through available workshops, teambuilding exercises, and on the job training. We offer flexible scheduling that helps employees maintain a healthy work-life balance.

Click here to see an inside look at the Texas Comptroller’s office!

ABOUT THE Division

General description
The Texas Comptroller's Office is looking for an Asset and Contract Manager to join our Information Technology Division. This role will assist procuring the agency’s software and hardware needs. The day-to-day responsibilities will include developing and managing projects through the Asset & Contract Management lifecycle and working closely with the requesting divisions, Budget, Legal, and the Contract Administration and Procurement divisions. You would be a great fit for this role if you work well in a fast-paced environment, works well with others, and adaptive to continuous changing circumstances.

Work Hours
Work hours are 8:00AM to 5:00PM, 40-hour week, Monday – Friday. Occasionally work additional hours on evenings, weekends or holidays. Hours may change based on business need.
Teleworking may be considered if certain working conditions are met. The candidate must have permanent residency within the state of Texas and must be able to meet in office requirements, which can vary among different sections (i.e., report to office 2 days/week, etc.) and additional days if requested. Travel reimbursements are not provided for teleworking.

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree.
• Five (5) years’ experience in the development of Statements of Work, Asset Management, or Property Management with an emphasis on procuring or managing hardware or software assets and related services.
• Three (3) years’ experience in contract administration, management, evaluation, or monitoring of contract providers.
• Experience in reviewing procurement or contract solicitation instruments (RFP, RFQ, RFO, and DIR Price Request (PR))

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in business or public administration, computer science, law, or a related field.
• Three (3) years’ experience with implementing and managing IT procurements and/or contracts.
• Recent (within last two years) Texas state agency procurement or contract management experience.
• One (1) year or more experience with planning, developing, drafting, managing or overseeing contract instruments or purchase orders per the guidelines and procedures published in the Texas Procurement Manual and the Texas Contract Management Guide.

Substitutions
• One additional year of experience in the development of Statement of Work for IT systems, hardware and software may substitute for thirty (30) semester hours of the required education, with a maximum substitution of 120 semester hours (four years).
• Certification as a Texas Contract Manager (CTCM) may substitute for up to one year of the required experience or thirty semester hours (one year) of the required education, but may not substitute for both experience and education.

LICENSES / CERTIFICATIONS
Required:
Certification as a CTCM/CSAM/CHAMP/CITAM must be obtained within 12 months of employment.

Preferred:
Certified Texas Contract Manager (CTCM)
Certified Software Asset Manager (CSAM)
Certified Hardware Asset Manager (CHAMP)
Certified IT Asset Manager (CITAM)

SUMMARY OF PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are represented of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This position requires the incumbent to primarily perform sedentary office work; however, mobility (standing and walking) is routinely required to carry out some duties. It requires extensive computer, telephone and client/customer contact. The job also requires normal cognitive abilities requiring the ability to learn, recall, and apply certain practices and policies. It requires the stamina to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions. Marginal or corrected visual and auditory requirements are required for reading printed materials and computer screens and communicating with internal and external customers. Also, this position requires the incumbent must be able to ride elevator; must be able to carry laptop home for on-call duties, must be able to sit for hours at one time, must be able to work on a pc keying program changes as a repetitive function.

Employees are required to use their personal mobile phones as a part of 2 factor/multi factor authentication for accessing CPA systems securely. You will also receive critical/emergency calls/texts on your cell phone to ensure immediate communication.

In this role you will:
IT Asset Procurement
• Prepares solicitations for software, hardware, and/or professional services, and coordinate evaluation and selection of vendor responses.
• Prepares complex solicitations by working with the business areas to develop high-level functional and technical requirements.
• Reviews and negotiates new software licenses, maintenance agreements, and professional services agreements.
• Requisition purchases of IT assets, licenses, maintenance renewals, leases, and/or subscriptions.
• Assists end-users, purchasers, and contract managers/monitors with all phases of the procurement process or contract life-cycle.
• Coordinates with IT Contract Administration staff on the receipt of purchase orders, invoice tracking and reconcile changes in inventory.

IT Asset Management
• Administers enterprise wide IT asset management program, coordinates with IT Asset stakeholders to provide direction on IT Asset Management best practices, procedures and technology directives.
• Manages IT asset inventory in a tracking system.
• Uses software discovery tools in client, distributed and mainframe environments to monitor software or hardware use and maintain software license compliance.
• Performs internal & external software audits as required.
• Monitors hardware infrastructure change requests and assess possible impacts to license entitlements.
• Serves as liaison to the IT Contract Administration staff and the Legal Contracts staff as it relates to the functions of IT Asset Management.
• Ensures IT Division and legal guidelines are followed for managing IT hardware or software assets.
• Manage complex assets to ensure compliance with contact terms and conditions.
• Coordinates with IT Asset stakeholders to provide direction on IT Asset Management best practices, procedures and technology directives.

Contract Management
• Manages and documents complex IT contracts throughout contract asset life cycle.
• Works with business areas when issues arise for compliance with complex contract compliance.
• Coordinates with agency management and contract stakeholders on any issues related to contract documents and contract performance.
• Monitors and reports upon contractor performance and/or progress to ensure goods and services conform to the contract requirements.

Performs other related duties as assigned

Maximize Your Earnings!

At the Comptroller's office, we know potential employees are looking for more than just a paycheck. The agency offers a strong benefits package for you and your family. Insurance, retirement plans, and a flexible work schedule are just the start. See our benefits offering

If you are seeking to gain knowledge, build your career, and network among goal-oriented professionals, this is the place for you!

Important Note to the Candidate:

Salary is contingent upon qualifications. If you are scheduled for an interview and require any reasonable accommodation in our interview process, please inform the hiring representative who calls you to schedule your interview. Whenever possible, please give the hiring representative sufficient time to consider and respond to your request.

MILITARY PREFERENCE

To receive MILITARY PREFERENCE, you are required to provide proof by attaching the necessary documentation to this job application.

https://hr.sao.texas.gov/CompensationSystem/JobDescriptions
Click on the occupational category for the position.

Additional MOS can be found at the State Auditor’s Office,

Military Crosswalk Guide.

The Texas Veterans Commission provides helpful employment information. Go to: http://www.texasskillstowork.com, http://www.onetonline.org, https://hr.sao.texas.gov/CompensationSystem/JobDescriptions/ or www.careeronestop.org for assistance translating your military experience and training courses into civilian job terms, qualifications/requirements and skill sets.

Applications submitted through Work in Texas:

Work In Texas (WIT) applicants must complete supplemental questions to be considered for the position. To complete the supplemental questions please go to CAPPS Recruit to register or login and access your profile.

The Comptroller’s Office is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity.

An applicant must be eligible to work in the United States to be hired at the Comptroller's office and must remain eligible, without sponsorship or any assurance of financial or other assistance from this agency, during the term of their employment.

title: Staff ServiceNow IT Asset Management Developer/Engineer
description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand - with heart at its center - our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.
Our Heart At Work Behaviors support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.
Position Summary
This position is an engineer role on the IT Asset Management team. The individual in this role will support design, execute, and maintain SAM Pro and HAM Pro modules as well as ServiceNow integrations across multiple modules. Liaising with technology teams, process owners and counterparts to define, execute and manage application sustainment, enhancement, and/or new development. Reporting to the Lead IT Director, Architecture , this position is critical in supporting the development and implementation of the overall ServiceNow Asset Management tools. This role will also have cross functional collaboration with other areas of ServiceNow Platform, including but not limited to being the first point of contact for defect management, and new enhancements development for Asset Management.
Required Qualifications
- 7+ years of developing on the ServiceNow platform
- 2 years of experience developing ServiceNow HAM Pro and SAM Pro modules.
- 5+ years of Advanced Scripting such as Java/Python
- 5+ years of leveraging and developing ServiceNow API/Integration capabilities
- 5+ years of ServiceNow Portal Development such as components using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, etc
- 5+ years of ServiceNow experience that expands beyond Catalog Services and ITSM
Preferred Qualifications
- 5+ years of demonstrated leadership experience in managing large scale
- corporate projects/technical staff
- 3+ years ITIL/Agile experience
- 3+ years experience leading a team of developers

title: Technology Asset Manager
description: Technology Asset Manager Millennium is seeking a talented and experienced Technology Asset Manager to join our team. As a Technology Asset Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the organization's IT hardware asset portfolio. Your role will involve strategic planning, process improvement, and effective management of IT assets throughout their lifecycle including utilizing your expertise in inventory management and proficient knowledge of ServiceNow software to ensure accurate and efficient tracking of our technology assets across the organization. Reporting on asset utilization, flows and values to management is required. This is a new role at the firm and will require the successful candidate to work across multiple departments to understand, document and rationalize existing, disparate processes. Once preferred process is defined and agreed, global implementation will require technical support from our ServiceNow tool and co-ordination of change adoption across multiple groups. Key Responsibilities Strategic Asset Management: Develop and implement effective technology asset management strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure pragmatic management of the firm’s physical technology assets. Ensure compliance across the organization. Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in IT asset management. Asset Planning: Manage the complete lifecycle of technology assets, from acquisition to disposal, ensuring optimal utilization and cost efficiency. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify IT Hardware Asset needs and requirements. This includes liaison with product managers to maintain a current set of technology products. Collaborate with and support various business units and technology teams in understanding and establishing data driven demand. Asset Inventory and Lifecycle Management: Develop and maintain an accurate and updated technology asset inventory, including detailed records of asset attributes, ownership, location, and financial information. Perform routine audits and reconciliations of technology assets to identify discrepancies, resolve issues, and ensure accurate reporting. Develop and implement standard procedures for asset tracking, disposal, and secure data destruction. Develop, improve and implement Governance and control processes to maintain data integrity Build, develop and maintain reporting dashboards using KPI's (Key Performance Indicators) aligned with the organization's goals and objectives. Utilize ServiceNow software and other asset management tools to automate processes, track inventory, and generate insightful reports and analysis. Qualifications and Skills Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, or a related field. Proven track record of at least 7 years in technology asset management, preferably within the financial services industry. Strong knowledge of inventory management processes, best practices, and industry standards. Proficiency in using ServiceNow or similar asset management software platforms. Solid understanding of procurement and provisioning workflows for technology assets. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders and build relationships. Detail-oriented mindset with exceptional organizational and documentation skills. Familiarity with IT asset lifecycle management, including depreciation and disposal processes. Understanding of industry regulations related to technology asset management, such as licensing, data security, and compliance. Certifications such as IT Asset Management (ITAM) or Certified Hardware Asset Management Professional (CHAMP) are highly desirable. The estimated base salary range for this position is $100,000 to $175,000, which is specific to New York and may change in the future. Millennium pays a total compensation package which includes a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package. When finalizing an offer, we take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package. title: IT Asset Manager
description:
Summary

The IT Asset Manager at ByteDance will develop and implement effective IT asset management strategies. Responsibilities include developing a comprehensive asset management roadmap, optimizing asset utilization, managing budgets and procurement, ensuring compliance, and generating insightful reports. Collaboration with various departments is crucial for evaluating existing processes, identifying improvement areas, and implementing innovative solutions to reduce costs and enhance efficiency. The role requires strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, along with expertise in IT asset management tools and systems.

Must Have
• 5+ years IT experience, 3+ years in ITAM
• ITAM tool experience (ServiceNow, Flexera etc.)
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Develop and implement IT asset management strategies
• Manage IT asset budgets and procurement

Good To Have
• Strategic thinking and project management skills
• PMP certification
• Understanding of regulations and compliance
• Experience in large global organizations
• ITAM certifications (CAMP, CSAM, CHAMP)

Perks
• Medical, dental, and vision insurance
• 401(k) savings plan with company match
• Paid parental leave
• Paid time off (holidays, sick days, personal time)
• Wellbeing benefits

Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact-for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

Team Introduction
The IT Asset Management team is responsible for establishing and optimizing a set of strategies, policies, and processes that effectively manage the entire life cycle of IT assets used within an enterprise or organization. It involves all stages, from requirement analysis, budget, procurement, deployment, usage, and maintenance to final decommissioning.

Our goal is to ensure that IT assets can be reasonably utilized, maximize their value, comply with legal and regulatory requirements, and help enterprises control costs, reduce risks and improve operational efficiency, and achieve elegant user experience and empower productivity

As an IT Asset Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing effective IT asset management strategies for the organization. You will work with various departments to evaluate existing asset management processes, identify improvement opportunities, and develop and implement innovative solutions to improve asset utilization, reduce costs, and ensure compliance.

Responsibilities
1. Asset Management Strategy & Roadmap Development, Technology Research and Trend Tracking, Asset Inventory Policy, Process Maturity Assessment and Optimization:
a. Partner with the organization's senior management to understand business goals & needs.
b. Stay updated on the latest asset management technologies and trends, offering insights and recommendations to help the organization maintain a competitive edge.
c. Design IT Asset Management strategies for hardware, software, procurement, logistics, and supply chain management, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
d. Review and evaluate existing IT asset management processes maturity to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement.
e. Develop and optimize inventory strategy of IT assets, including hardware, software, licenses, and contracts.
f. Ensure inventory management and core KPIs can support business analysis and decision-making in multiple business scenarios.

2. Asset Operation Efficiency and Improvement, Asset Utilization Analysis, Cost Management, Procurement, and Vendor Management:
a. Analyze asset utilization data, identify underutilized or idle assets, and develop optimization plans.
b. Develop IT asset budgets, monitor expenditures, and provide cost-benefit analysis to help the organization make informed decisions.
c. Participate in purchasing decisions for IT assets, and negotiate contracts and maintenance agreements with vendors to ensure best value.

3. Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure that the organization complies with regulations and policies related to IT asset management, identify and manage risks associated with assets.

4. Reporting and Analysis: Generate regular asset management reports, and provide insights on asset status, utilization, and cost to support decision-making.

5. Training and Knowledge Sharing:
a. Provide IT asset management training to relevant personnel within the organization, and share best practices and new asset management methods.
b. Working closely with internal development teams, and quality assurance (QA) to ensure business requirements are developed and released as high-quality products on a timely basis
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
1. Bachelor's degree or above, preferred in computer science, information technology or related fields.
2. At least 5 years+ of IT experience, familiar with ITIL, includes more than 3 years of IT asset management: hardware, software, digital assets or related field work experience. ITAM industry certifications are preferred, such as CAMP, CSAM, CHAMP.
3. Familiar with IT asset management tools and systems, and have used/understood the industry's top IT asset management tools such as Service Now, Flexera, Snow, Trelica, etc. Familiar with UEM tools such as Microsoft Intune, Ivanti LAN Desk, Manage Engine, etc.
4. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with data analysis capabilities.
5. Willingness to continuously learn and improve oneself to keep up with the development of technology and industry.

Preferred Qualifications:
1. Strategic thinking and proven record of leading comprehensive IT projects, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to work with people at all levels and functions.
2. Strong project management and organizational skills, able to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously. Project management certifications such as PMP are preferred
3. Strong industrial know-how and hands-on practice in large and global organizations
4. In-depth understanding of regulations and compliance requirements. Have an in-depth understanding of industry top software vendor license terms and conditions.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance Inc. is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/cdpT2
Job Information
【For Pay Transparency】Compensation Description (Annually)

The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $130844 - $255600 annually.​

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.​

Benefits may vary depending on the nature of employment and the country work location. Employees have day one access to medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) savings plan with company match, paid parental leave, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits, among others. Employees also receive 10 paid holidays per year, 10 paid sick days per year and 17 days of Paid Personal Time (prorated upon hire with increasing accruals by tenure).​

The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.​

For Los Angeles County (unincorporated) Candidates:​

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Our company believes that criminal history may have a direct, adverse and negative relationship on the following job duties, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of the conditional offer of employment:​

1. Interacting and occasionally having unsupervised contact with internal/external clients and/or colleagues;​

2. Appropriately handling and managing confidential information including proprietary and trade secret information and access to information technology systems; and​

3. Exercising sound judgment.​

title: IT Asset Manager
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and experienced IT Asset Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with ServiceNow SAM Professional and a strong understanding of the software asset management lifecycle. The role involves managing and optimizing IT asset inventory, ensuring accurate licensing, and providing industry best practices for software and hardware asset management. While ServiceNow CIS-SAM certification and IAITIAM CSAM certification are preferred, they are not required.

Key Responsibilities:
• ServiceNow SAM Management:
• Utilize ServiceNow SAM Professional to manage and oversee the software asset management lifecycle from requisition through retirement.
• Work with ServiceNow platform elements that integrate with the Asset Management Module, including IT Service Management, ServiceNow Discovery, CMDB, Vendor Management, Contract Management, and Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager Spoke.
• License and Contract Management:
• Conduct quality checks of customers’ contract and purchase information to maintain accurate and complete summaries of licenses.
• Ensure correct application of license rules to hardware and software inventory data, reflecting accurate contractual entitlement.
• Compare contractual entitlements with utilization to assess licensing gaps and surpluses, and provide consulting services on best practices to optimize licensing positions and avoid unnecessary costs.
• Data Management and Analysis:
• Collect, cleanse, and normalize software discovery and inventory information to ensure all relevant licensing data points are captured.
• Oversee the maintenance of accurate asset records and ensure data integrity across the asset management system.
• Best Practices and Recommendations:
• Provide industry recommendations and best practices for managing software and hardware assets.
• Share practical experience on the convergence between software and hardware asset management, offering insights on managing both concurrently.
• Continuous Improvement:
• Stay updated on industry trends and changes in asset management practices.
• Recommend improvements to processes and tools to enhance asset management efficiency and effectiveness.

Requirements:
• Experience:
• Minimum of 2 years of experience using ServiceNow SAM Professional.
• Minimum of 2 years of experience working with ServiceNow platform elements that integrate with the Asset Management Module, such as IT Service Management, ServiceNow Discovery, CMDB, Vendor Management, Contract Management, or Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager Spoke.
• Minimum of 3 years of expertise in the entire software asset management lifecycle.
• Skills and Knowledge:
• Proven experience in quality check analysis of contracts and purchase information.
• Expertise in applying license rules to inventory data and assessing licensing gaps and surpluses.
• Experience in collecting, cleansing, and managing software discovery and inventory data.
• Ability to provide industry recommendations and best practices for asset management.
• Certifications (Preferred, but not required):
• ServiceNow CIS-SAM certification.
• IAITIAM CSAM certification.

Preferred Skills:
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

About:

Federal Working Group is a Northern Virginia-based small business committed to delivering value through trust and loyalty of our customers, retaining highly skilled and experienced professionals, practical application of structured management frameworks, and implementing current best practices.

Federal Working Group’s core competencies are Agile IT Programs, Project Management Services, Enterprise Portfolio Management & Governance Services, Infrastructure Strategy & Data Center Supports, and IT Security, Strategy & Operations.

Federal Working Group was established in 2004 as a competitive and high-performing company. The organization over the year has successfully grown from 4 employees to over 100. In addition, to being recognized as an outstanding solutions provider, Federal Working Group also has a proven track record to exceed customers’ expectations.

Federal Working Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Job Requirements

title: IT Asset manager - ITAM, ITOM, SAM & HAM
description:
About the position

The IT Asset Manager role at Amtex Systems Inc focuses on managing IT asset management processes, including Software Asset Management (SAM) and Hardware Asset Management (HAM). The position requires a strong understanding of IT Asset Management and Configuration Management Database (CMDB) using ServiceNow products, with an emphasis on liaising between business and technical teams to ensure alignment with business needs. This is a contract position based in NYC with a requirement to be onsite one day a week.

Responsibilities
• 5+ years of IT Asset Management and CMDB experience with using ServiceNow ITAM/ITOM products
,
• Prioritize the grooming of the product backlog, serving as the voice of the customers and ensuring prioritization based on business value
,
• Liaise between business and technical team to ensure business needs are met
,
• Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming business needs into actionable requirements with ITAM/CMDB/ITOM
,
• Technical aptitude to self-validate solution approaches, assess initial feasibility, and drive discussions with the business and technical teams
,
• Monitoring and evaluating progress of requests through completion
,
• Previous experience implementing and running SAM & HAM
,
• Prior experience prioritizing Asset Management tickets from various Asset Management modules
,
• Prior experience working with Process Owner/Mgrs gathering feedback/request/enhancements and then prioritizing
,
• Prior PM experience

Requirements
• 5+ years of IT Asset Management experience
,
• Experience with ServiceNow ITAM/ITOM products
,
• Strong communication skills to liaise between business and technical teams
,
• Ability to gather and transform business needs into actionable requirements
,
• Technical aptitude for solution validation and feasibility assessment
,
• Experience in monitoring and evaluating project progress
,
• Experience in implementing and running Software Asset Management (SAM) and Hardware Asset Management (HAM)
,
• Experience prioritizing Asset Management tickets
,
• Experience working with Process Owners and Managers

Nice-to-haves

Benefits
